Title: How Dr. Brandon Kohrt is Expanding Access to Mental Health Care
Author: a531ff45-0ba0-4cc5-9ee8-26a12e5e8cba
Excerpt: From documentary filmmaker to global health pioneer, Brandon Kohrt has transformed the landscape of global mental health care worldwide. By combining deep cultural insight with scientific rigor and technological innovation, Kohrt is building more inclusive, effective, and scalable mental health systems for the future, especially in underserved communities across the globe.
Plain Content: From documentary filmmaker to global health pioneer, Brandon Kohrt has transformed the landscape of mental health care worldwide. By combining deep cultural insight with scientific rigor and technological innovation, Kohrt is building more inclusive, effective, and scalable mental health systems for the future, especially in underserved communities across the globe.  When Observation Became Intervention Brandon Kohrt did not begin his career in a clinic or a lab, but instead behind a camera. As an undergraduate student at University of Southern California in the late 1990s, he journeyed to Nepal to document the reintegration of child soldiers into society following the country’s decade-long Maoist People’s War. Immersed in rural villages lacking formal healthcare infrastructure, Kohrt witnessed first-hand the extensive psychological trauma of war and the near-total absence of mental health support.  The resulting documentary, Returned: Child Soldiers of Nepal’s Maoist Army , premiered at Grauman’s Egyptian Theatre during the 2008 Artivist Film Festival, earning the Artivist Award for Children’s Advocacy and later winning Best Documentary Short at the Atlanta Underground Film Festival. Beyond acclaim, the project sparked Kohrt’s commitment to confronting the urgent question of what came next for the children he had followed on-screen. He came to see that their trauma was not isolated but reflected a far-reaching mental health crisis affecting entire communities.  In a country of nearly 23 million, with fewer than a dozen psychiatrists nationwide, most concentrated in the capital Kathmandu,  formal mental health care was almost entirely out of reach. Where services did exist, they relied on Western frameworks ill-suited to local realities. Kohrt recognized that importing Western psychiatric models was not only impractical but also risked reinforcing stigma and alienating those most in need of care. Effective solutions would need to leverage the existing social and cultural networks — families, spiritual leaders, and traditional healers — already integral to Nepali society.  Returned: Child Soldiers of Nepal’s Maoist Arm y Reimagining Mental Health Infrastructure Back in the United States, Kohrt shifted his focus to the urgent question that had emerged during his time in Nepal: how can mental health services be scaled in low-resource settings without losing cultural relevance?  To pursue this, Kohrt enrolled in a joint MD-PhD program at Emory University, where he studied psychiatry and anthropology. This dual training deepened his conviction that mental health is not only individual but fundamentally relational, inseparable from the well-being of families, social networks, and broader cultural systems that shape daily life. During his studies, Kohrt encountered the World Health Organization’s Mental Health Gap Action Program (mhGAP), a global initiative aimed at closing the treatment gap in countries with limited psychiatric resources. One of mhGAP’s core strategies, known as “ task-sharing ,” offered a promising alternative to traditional specialist driven models. Rather than waiting for a system to produce more psychiatrists or psychologists, task-sharing trains lay providers such as non-specialist nurses, midwives, and community volunteers to identify and deliver front-line care for common mental conditions. Kohrt recognized that this approach aligned with what he had observed in Nepal: care delivered by trusted community members, grounded in local norms and relationships, was often more effective and acceptable than top-down clinical interventions. Kohrt became both a practitioner and evaluator of this strategy. In a 2025 scoping review he co-authored, Kohrt and his colleagues examined dozens of task-sharing programs across diverse global contexts. The results  were striking: beyond expanding access to care, task-sharing often elevated the social status of community health providers and increased their sense of self-efficacy. These shifts helped embed mental health services into the everyday fabric of community life, creating sustainable, culturally relevant care networks in places where formal systems had long fallen short. To further evaluate task-sharing operations in practice, Kohrt joined Ugandan colleagues on a landmark cluster-randomized trial of Group Interpersonal Psychotherapy  (IPT-G), a 16-session, evidence-based intervention originally developed to treat depression. Delivered by trained lay counselors, IPT-G helps participants link mood changes to life events and develop strategies for managing interpersonal stress. The results were dramatic: before treatment, 86% of participants met diagnostic criteria for major depression; four months later that figure had fallen to 6.5% in IPT-G villages compared to 54.7% in controls. The 79% relative reduction was sustained six months later, setting a new global benchmark for psychological interventions delivered by non-specialists in low-resource settings. Tackling Stigma from Within Despite comprehensive technical training, Kohrt observed that many lay health workers still harbored deep-seated prejudices, rooted in cultural myths or fear, against those with mental illness, often leading to missed diagnoses and inadequate care.  Drawing on the success of HIV/AIDS stigma-reduction methods, which demonstrated that structured social contact with individuals living with HIV has demonstrably shifted healthcare workers beliefs and behaviors, Kohrt partnered with people with lived experience (PWLE) of mental illness, program designers, and mhGAP trainers to co-develop RESHAPE , reducing stigma among healthcare providers. In RESHAPE modules, PWLE moves beyond static textbook examples to serve as active educators who share personal recovery narratives, provide feedback on clinical role-plays, and even serve as mentors to newly trained clinicians. This immersive approach transforms stigma-reduction into an active, relational process grounded in empathy. In Nepal, the impact was measurable. Pilot studies showed significant reductions in stigma and implicit bias, along with improved diagnostic accuracy and treatment adherence. In a 34-clinic study , real patient diagnoses were 72.5% accurate among clinicians trained with RESHAPE versus 34.5% in the implementation-as-usual arm of the study. Beyond the data, trainees reported feeling a sense of “accountability” to their PWLE mentors. By embedding structured social contact into clinical education, RESHAPE went beyond technical skill-building, fostering empathy and challenging deep-seated biases. The result was not just more skilled providers, but a more humane system of care. Integrating Technology Into Human Care Recognizing that many remote Nepali communities lack reliable roads, electricity, or supervisory oversight, Kohrt’s teams also sought to increase in-person support without overburdening already scarce human resources. To do this, they developed StandStrong , a hybrid intervention that combines a behavioral activation curriculum with passive sensing to support care delivery in hard to reach areas. The five-session curriculum helps patients identify and schedule simple, mood-lifting activities - such as going for a walk or reconnecting with others - to interrupt the cycle of depression marked by withdrawal and avoidance.  What makes StandStrong  unique is its integration of passive sensing, which uses everyday smartphone features, like GPS, Bluetooth, and microphone snippets, to collect behavioral data on movement, proximity, and ambient speech. These signals are used to generate a privacy-safe “digital phenotype”: a visual snapshot of a patient's daily routines and activity levels, captured without requiring any manual input. This data allows counselors to monitor progress remotely and tailor support in real time, even in areas where face to face supervision isn't feasible. A 2024 proof-of-concept study in Nepal involving 24 adolescent and young mothers showed meaningful improvements in depression symptoms across all participants, as measured by the Beck Depression Inventory — a widely used clinical scale for assessing the severity of depressive symptoms. Counselors used color-coded heat maps generated from passive sensing data to tailor behavioral “homework” for each patient, such as encouraging a daily walk outside the home.   The results demonstrated StandStrong’s strength: using low-bandwidth technology to enrich, rather than replace, human care — making therapy more personalized, even from a distance. For rural communities with limited access to mental health services, tools like StandStrong offer more than scalability; they provide a culturally adaptable lifeline, showcasing how digital support can extend the reach of therapy without overwhelming providers. Standardizing Quality on a Global Scale As mental health task-sharing initiatives and digital therapies expanded worldwide, each tailored to unique languages, cultures, and resource levels, Kohrt identified a new critical challenge: ensuring that these varied programs maintain standards of safety and efficacy.  Together with WHO and UNICEF, Kohrt led the development of EQUIP  (Ensuring Quality in Psychosocial and Mental Health Care), a free digital platform designed to standardize training, supervision, and competency assessment across diverse settings.  At the core of EQUIP is the ENACT (Enhancing Assessment of Common therapeutic factors) checklist, and 18-item rating scale that captures essential counseling skills, such as empathy, active listening, and collaborative goal-setting. Trainees upload video recordings of actual or role-played sessions, which are then scored by remote supervisors or through semi-automated prompts; the platform flags any potentially harmful practices  such as the use of dismissive language and highlights strengths to reinforce. This structured feedback loop not only helps individual providers refine their skills but also generates aggregate data on training program performance, identifying areas where curriculum updates or additional sessions are needed. Since its public launch in March 2022, EQUIP has logged  over 10,000 competency assessments across 794 programs in 36 countries, involving more than 3,760 frontline providers. Early analyses show an 18% average improvement in observable healthcare provider skills compared to traditional lecture-based instruction. In creating a transparent, data-driven system for monitoring and enhancing counselor competencies, Kohrt ensured that scale would not come at the expense of quality.  Building a Global Hub in Washington, D.C. In Washington D.C., Kohrt serves as the Charles and Sonia Akman Professor of Global Psychiatry at George Washington University and founding director of the Center for Global Mental Health Equity , shaping a dedicated space on the Foggy Bottom campus where rigorous academic research and hands-on field experience converge.  As Scientific Co-Chair of NIH Fogarty’s Health research in Humanitarian Crises initiative and an academic partner-lead on WHO/UNICEF’s EQUIP platform, he continues to set global competency standards for non-specialist psychological care and oversees digital tools that support providers in over 40 countries. Brandon Kohrt, M.D., Ph.D., and Seidu Swaray of the Liberian Association for Psychosocial Services are conducting a needs assessment for the Carter Center in Lofa County, Liberia. ( Image Credit ) Since 2010, Kohrt has consulted to The Carter Center’s Liberia Mental-Health Initiative , co-designing anti-stigma radio campaigns and community-nurse training curricula that now underpin the Center’s own workshops and remote coaching programs.  Through this Washington-based hub, Kohrt ensures that lessons first learned in post-conflict Kathmandu now inform cutting-edge research, policy dialogues, and scalable, equity-driven interventions around the world, completing a global-to-local cycle.  Symbiosis as a Professional Philosophy Reflecting on his journey, Kohrt often returns to a guiding principle: progress in global mental health is shaped as much by relationships as by ambition. He describes this approach as symbiotic career planning  — a philosophy that emphasizes building a path not only around personal goals, but around the people and partnerships that sustain meaningful work as well. It’s a lesson rooted in his earliest experiences in Nepal and one that continues to shape his work today. Advancing global mental health depends on connection, not just between patients and providers, but among colleagues, communities, and systems across borders.  Drawing on anthropology, implementation science, and digital innovation, Kohrt builds interventions that are deeply rooted in local contexts yet designed for global impact. For him, the most enduring solutions are those built through mutual learning, where knowledge moves in every direction and relationships define the roadmap.

This data allows counselors to monitor progress remotely and tailor support in real time, even in areas where face to face supervision isn't feasible.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"vfegm477","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"24gkz478","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"A 2024 proof-of-concept study in Nepal involving 24 adolescent and young mothers showed meaningful improvements in depression symptoms across all participants, as measured by the Beck Depression Inventory — a widely used clinical scale for assessing the severity of depressive symptoms. Counselors used color-coded heat maps generated from passive sensing data to tailor behavioral “homework” for each patient, such as encouraging a daily walk outside the home.  ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"ix32t480","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"wx2c6481","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The results demonstrated StandStrong’s strength: using low-bandwidth technology to enrich, rather than replace, human care — making therapy more personalized, even from a distance. For rural communities with limited access to mental health services, tools like StandStrong offer more than scalability; they provide a culturally adaptable lifeline, showcasing how digital support can extend the reach of therapy without overwhelming providers.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"dsqgg483","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"DIVIDER","id":"a49md5833","nodes":[],"dividerData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":false,"height":{},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"CENTER","width":{}},"lineStyle":"SINGLE","width":"LARGE","alignment":"CENTER"}},{"style":{},"id":"3bujw485","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Standardizing Quality on a Global Scale","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"headingData":{"level":2,"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"type":"HEADING"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"81sk36016","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"xp961487","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"As mental health task-sharing initiatives and digital therapies expanded worldwide, each tailored to unique languages, cultures, and resource levels, Kohrt identified a new critical challenge: ensuring that these varied programs maintain standards of safety and efficacy. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"0g4wi489","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"y1e1o490","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Together with WHO and UNICEF, Kohrt led the development of ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"EQUIP","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700},{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lanpsy/article/PIIS2215-0366(24)00183-4/abstract","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" (Ensuring Quality in Psychosocial and Mental Health Care), a free digital platform designed to standardize training, supervision, and competency assessment across diverse settings. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"4i7hm494","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"yykmp495","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"At the core of EQUIP is the ENACT (Enhancing Assessment of Common therapeutic factors) checklist, and 18-item rating scale that captures essential counseling skills, such as empathy, active listening, and collaborative goal-setting. Trainees upload video recordings of actual or role-played sessions, which are then scored by remote supervisors or through semi-automated prompts; the platform ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"flags any potentially harmful practices","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://doi.org/10.1016/j.brat.2015.03.009","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" such as the use of dismissive language and highlights strengths to reinforce. This structured feedback loop not only helps individual providers refine their skills but also generates aggregate data on training program performance, identifying areas where curriculum updates or additional sessions are needed.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"6wonw499","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"s7mf9500","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Since its public launch in March 2022, EQUIP has ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"logged","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://doi.org/10.1016/s2215-0366(24)00183-4","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" over 10,000 competency assessments across 794 programs in 36 countries, involving more than 3,760 frontline providers. Early analyses show an 18% average improvement in observable healthcare provider skills compared to traditional lecture-based instruction. In creating a transparent, data-driven system for monitoring and enhancing counselor competencies, Kohrt ensured that scale would not come at the expense of quality. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"0dbr6504","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"DIVIDER","id":"rryp06317","nodes":[],"dividerData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":false,"height":{},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"CENTER","width":{}},"lineStyle":"SINGLE","width":"LARGE","alignment":"CENTER"}},{"style":{},"id":"wzskb506","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Building a Global Hub in Washington, D.C.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"headingData":{"level":2,"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"type":"HEADING"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"qnuff508","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"skggy509","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"In Washington D.C., Kohrt serves as the Charles and Sonia Akman Professor of Global Psychiatry at George Washington University and founding director of the ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Center for Global Mental Health Equity","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://www.gwglobalmentalhealth.com/","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":", shaping a dedicated space on the Foggy Bottom campus where rigorous academic research and hands-on field experience converge. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"kvh3i513","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"tb3ye514","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"As Scientific Co-Chair of NIH Fogarty’s Health research in Humanitarian Crises initiative and an academic partner-lead on WHO/UNICEF’s EQUIP platform, he continues to set global competency standards for non-specialist psychological care and oversees digital tools that support providers in over 40 countries.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"agrvp516","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"IMAGE","id":"i85f47046","nodes":[{"style":{"paddingTop":"6px","paddingBottom":"6px"},"captionData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO","lineHeight":"1.3"}},"id":"xk5v47103","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Brandon Kohrt, M.D., Ph.D., and Seidu Swaray of the Liberian Association for Psychosocial Services are conducting a needs assessment for the Carter Center in Lofa County, Liberia. (","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"foreground":"#000624"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Image Credit","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"foreground":"#000624"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://psychiatryonline.org/doi/10.1176/appi.pn.2013.6b2","target":"BLANK","rel":{"noreferrer":true}}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":")","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"CAPTION"}],"imageData":{"containerData":{"width":{"size":"SMALL"},"alignment":"CENTER","textWrap":true},"image":{"src":{"id":"11b1c4_44258f0e910f49819d7790aa2958047b~mv2.jpg"},"width":1200,"height":888},"caption":"Brandon Kohrt, M.D., Ph.D., and Seidu Swaray of the Liberian Association for Psychosocial Services are conducting a needs assessment for the Carter Center in Lofa County, Liberia. (Image Credit)"}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"4kpfy521","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"exi62522","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Since 2010, Kohrt has consulted to ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The Carter Center’s Liberia Mental-Health Initiative","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://www.cartercenter.org/news/features/h/mental_health/rlrc-brandonkohrt.html","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":", co-designing anti-stigma radio campaigns and community-nurse training curricula that now underpin the Center’s own workshops and remote coaching programs. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"bmmkg526","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"liy09527","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Through this Washington-based hub, Kohrt ensures that lessons first learned in post-conflict Kathmandu now inform cutting-edge research, policy dialogues, and scalable, equity-driven interventions around the world, completing a global-to-local cycle. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"5d415529","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"DIVIDER","id":"acmsh8993","nodes":[],"dividerData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":false,"height":{},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"CENTER","width":{}},"lineStyle":"SINGLE","width":"LARGE","alignment":"CENTER"}},{"style":{},"id":"7hin9531","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Symbiosis as a Professional Philosophy","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700},{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"headingData":{"level":3,"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"type":"HEADING"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"aud2x533","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"gpyqh534","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Reflecting on his journey, Kohrt often returns to a guiding principle: progress in global mental health is shaped as much by relationships as by ambition. He describes this approach as ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"symbiotic career planning","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700},{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" — a philosophy that emphasizes building a path not only around personal goals, but around the people and partnerships that sustain meaningful work as well. It’s a lesson rooted in his earliest experiences in Nepal and one that continues to shape his work today. Advancing global mental health depends on connection, not just between patients and providers, but among colleagues, communities, and systems across borders. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"toa29538","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"wgnxe539","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Drawing on anthropology, implementation science, and digital innovation, Kohrt builds interventions that are deeply rooted in local contexts yet designed for global impact. For him, the most enduring solutions are those built through mutual learning, where knowledge moves in every direction and relationships define the roadmap.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"#000624"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"u4nqh9272","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"HTML","id":"hxhxi12400","nodes":[],"htmlData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":true,"height":{"custom":"574"},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"CENTER","width":{"custom":"940"}},"html":"<!DOCTYPE --accent-neon-yellow: #ffd700;\n  --accent-neon-electricblue: #00d4ff;\n  --accent: var(--accent-neon-lime);\n\n  /* Game Element Colors */\n  --player-fill: var(--accent);\n  --player-glow: var(--accent);\n  --platform-fill: #1a1a2e;\n  --platform-highlight: #16213e;\n  --platform-outline: rgba(0, 229, 255, 0.3);\n  --block-active-fill: var(--accent-neon-orange);\n  --block-active-glow: var(--accent-neon-orange);\n  --block-key-color: var(--accent-neon-yellow);\n  --block-used-fill: #2c2c3e;\n  --block-correct-fill: var(--accent-neon-lime);\n  --coin-fill: var(--accent-neon-yellow);\n  --coin-glow: var(--accent-neon-yellow);\n  --enemy-mite-fill: var(--accent-neon-magenta);\n  --enemy-mite-glow: var(--accent-neon-magenta);\n  --enemy-golem-fill: var(--accent-neon-orange);\n  --enemy-golem-glow: var(--accent-neon-orange);\n  --goal-fill: var(--accent-neon-electricblue);\n  --goal-glow: var(--accent-neon-electricblue);\n  --goal-portal-accent: #ffffff;\n  --goal-locked-fill: #2a2a3e;\n  --projectile-fill: #ffffff;\n  --projectile-glow: var(--accent);\n  --hud-text-color: var(--text-color-on-dark);\n  --button-text-color: var(--accent);\n  --button-bg-hover: var(--accent);\n  --button-text-hover: var(--text-color-dark-for-button-hover);\n  --font: 'Segoe UI', 'Arial', sans-serif;\n  --glow-intensity: 6px;\n}\n\n* {\n  box-sizing: border-box;\n  margin: 0;\n  padding: 0;\n}\n\nbody {\n  font-family: var(--font);\n  background: transparent;\n  color: var(--text-color-on-dark);\n  display: flex;\n  justify-content: center;\n  align-items: center;\n  min-height: 100vh;\n  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;\n  overflow: hidden;\n}\n\n.wrap {\n  width: 100%;\n  max-width: 800px;\n  margin: 1.5em 1.5em;\n  padding: 20px;\n  background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--bg-wrap) 0%, rgba(10, 10, 15, 0.95) 100%);\n  border-radius: 20px;\n  box-shadow: 0 0 20px rgba(0, 229, 255, 0.3), inset 0 0 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);\n  text-align: center;\n  border: 2px solid var(--accent);\n  position: relative;\n  backdrop-filter: blur(5px);\n}\n\n#gameInstruction {\n  font-size: 0.85em;\n  color: var(--text-color-on-dark);\n  margin-bottom: 0.5em;\n  opacity: 0.8;\n  letter-spacing: 0.5px;\n}\n\nh2 {\n  margin: 0 0 0.8em;\n  font-size: 1.5em;\n  color: var(--text-color-on-dark);\n  text-shadow: 0 0 10px var(--accent), 0 0 20px var(--accent);\n  letter-spacing: 1px;\n  font-weight: 600;\n}\n\n#gameCanvasContainer {\n  position: relative;\n  margin: 0 auto;\n  border-radius: 10px;\n  overflow: hidden;\n  box-shadow: 0 4px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);\n}\n\ncanvas {\n  border: 3px solid var(--accent);\n  border-radius: 10px;\n  display: block;\n  width: 100%;\n  height: auto;\n  aspect-ratio: 720 / 300;\n  image-rendering: optimizeSpeed;\n  box-shadow: 0 0 20px var(--accent), inset 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);\n  touch-action: none;\n  background: var(--bg-main-canvas);\n}\n\n#hud {\n  font-size: 0.9em;\n  margin: 0.8em 0;\n  color: var(--hud-text-color);\n  text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.7);\n  font-weight: 500;\n  letter-spacing: 0.5px;\n}\n\nbutton {\n  padding: 12px 24px;\n  font-size: 0.9em;\n  margin: 5px;\n  border: 2px solid var(--button-text-color);\n  background: linear-gradient(135deg, transparent, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05));\n  color: var(--button-text-color);\n  cursor: pointer;\n  transition: all 0.3s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1);\n  text-transform: uppercase;\n  letter-spacing: 1.5px;\n  font-weight: 600;\n  box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 229, 255, 0.3);\n  border-radius: 5px;\n  position: relative;\n  overflow: hidden;\n}\n\nbutton::before {\n  content: '';\n  position: absolute;\n  top: 50%;\n  left: 50%;\n  width: 0;\n  height: 0;\n  background: var(--button-bg-hover);\n  border-radius: 50%;\n  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);\n  transition: width 0.3s, height 0.3s;\n}\n\nbutton:hover::before {\n  width: 120%;\n  height: 120%;\n}\n\nbutton:hover {\n  color: var(--button-text-hover);\n  transform: translateY(-2px);\n  box-shadow: 0 5px 20px var(--button-bg-hover), 0 0 30px var(--button-bg-hover);\n  border-color: var(--button-bg-hover);\n}\n\nbutton:active {\n  transform: translateY(0);\n}\n\nbutton:disabled {\n  opacity: 0.4;\n  cursor: not-allowed;\n  transform: none;\n}\n\n#pauseBtn {\n  display: none;\n}\n\n#gamePausedOverlay {\n  position: absolute;\n  top: 0;\n  left: 0;\n  width: 100%;\n  height: 100%;\n  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);\n  color: white;\n  font-size: 2.5em;\n  display: flex;\n  align-items: center;\n  justify-content: center;\n  z-index: 5000;\n  border-radius: 10px;\n  pointer-events: none;\n  backdrop-filter: blur(5px);\n  text-shadow: 0 0 20px var(--accent);\n  letter-spacing: 3px;\n}\n\n#msg {\n  font-size: 1.2em;\n  min-height: 1.5em;\n  margin-top: 0.5em;\n  font-weight: 600;\n  color: var(--text-color-on-dark);\n  text-shadow: 2px 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5), 0 0 10px var(--accent);\n  letter-spacing: 0.5px;\n}\n\n/* Enhanced Question Modal */\n#questionModal {\n  position: absolute;\n  top: 0;\n  left: 0;\n  right: 0;\n  bottom: 0;\n  background: rgba(5, 5, 8, 0.95);\n  display: flex;\n  align-items: center;\n  justify-content: center;\n  z-index: 10000;\n  opacity: 0;\n  pointer-events: none;\n  transition: opacity 0.4s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1);\n  border-radius: 20px;\n  backdrop-filter: blur(10px);\n}\n\n#questionModal.visible {\n  opacity: 1;\n  pointer-events: auto;\n}\n\n#qBox {\n  background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--bg-main-canvas) 0%, rgba(26, 26, 46, 0.95) 100%);\n  padding: 25px;\n  border-radius: 15px;\n  border: 3px solid var(--accent);\n  box-shadow: 0 0 30px var(--accent), inset 0 0 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);\n  width: 90%;\n  max-width: 500px;\n  text-align: center;\n  color: var(--text-color-on-dark);\n  transform: scale(0.9);\n  transition: transform 0.3s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1);\n}\n\n#questionModal.visible #qBox {\n  transform: scale(1);\n}\n\n#qText {\n  font-size: 1.1em;\n  margin-bottom: 20px;\n  line-height: 1.5;\n  font-weight: 500;\n}\n\n#qOptionsContainer button {\n  display: block;\n  width: 100%;\n  margin: 10px 0;\n  padding: 15px;\n  font-size: 0.95em;\n  border: 2px solid rgba(0, 229, 255, 0.5);\n  background: linear-gradient(135deg, transparent, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05));\n  color: var(--accent);\n  border-radius: 8px;\n  cursor: pointer;\n  transition: all 0.3s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1);\n  text-align: left;\n  position: relative;\n  overflow: hidden;\n}\n\n#qOptionsContainer button::before {\n  content: '';\n  position: absolute;\n  left: -100%;\n  top: 0;\n  width: 100%;\n  height: 100%;\n  background: linear-gradient(90deg, transparent, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2), transparent);\n  transition: left 0.5s;\n}\n\n#qOptionsContainer button:hover::before {\n  left: 100%;\n}\n\n#qOptionsContainer button:hover:not(:disabled) {\n  background: var(--accent);\n  color: var(--button-text-hover);\n  box-shadow: 0 0 20px var(--accent);\n  transform: translateX(5px);\n  border-color: var(--accent);\n}\n\n#qOptionsContainer button:disabled {\n  opacity: 0.6;\n  cursor: default;\n  transform: none;\n}\n\n#qFeedback {\n  min-height: 1.5em;\n  margin-top: 15px;\n  font-weight: 600;\n  font-size: 0.95em;\n  line-height: 1.4;\n  transition: all 0.3s;\n}\n\n#qFeedback.correct {\n  color: var(--accent-neon-lime);\n  text-shadow: 0 0 10px var(--accent-neon-lime);\n}\n\n#qFeedback.incorrect {\n  color: var(--accent-neon-magenta);\n  text-shadow: 0 0 10px var(--accent-neon-magenta);\n}\n\n/* Responsive Design */\n@media (max-width: 399px) {\n  .wrap { display: none !important; }\n}\n\n@media (min-width: 400px) and (max-width: 600px) {\n  .wrap { width: 98%; padding: 15px; }\n  #gameInstruction { font-size: 0.75em; }\n  h2 { font-size: 1.2em; }\n  #hud { font-size: 0.8em; }\n  button { padding: 10px 16px; font-size: 0.8em; }\n  #msg { font-size: 1em; }\n  #qBox { padding: 20px; }\n  #qText { font-size: 1em; }\n  #qOptionsContainer button { padding: 12px; font-size: 0.9em; }\n}\n\n/* Loading Animation */\n@keyframes pulse {\n  0% { opacity: 0.6; }\n  50% { opacity: 1; }\n  100% { opacity: 0.6; }\n}\n\n.loading {\n  animation: pulse 1.5s infinite;\n}\n</style>\n</head>\n<body>\n<div class=\"wrap\">\n  <p id=\"gameInstruction\">🎮 Test your knowledge about global mental health innovation!</p>\n  <h2>🧠 Global Mental Health Dash: Kohrt's Innovations</h2>\n  <div id=\"gameCanvasContainer\">\n    <canvas id=\"cv\" width=\"720\" height=\"300\"></canvas>\n    <div id=\"gamePausedOverlay\" style=\"display: none;\">PAUSED</div>\n  </div>\n  <div id=\"hud\">Score: 0 | Lives: 3 | Time: 120s</div>\n  <button id=\"btn\" type=\"button\">Start Game</button>\n  <button id=\"pauseBtn\" type=\"button\">Pause</button>\n  <div id=\"msg\"></div>\n  <div id=\"questionModal\">\n    <div id=\"qBox\">\n      <p id=\"qText\"></p>\n      <div id=\"qOptionsContainer\"></div>\n      <p id=\"qFeedback\"></p>\n    </div>\n  </div>\n</div>\n\n<script>\n/* ========== ENHANCED GAME ENGINE ========== */\n\n// Performance optimizations\nconst RAF = window.requestAnimationFrame || window.webkitRequestAnimationFrame || window.mozRequestAnimationFrame;\nconst now = () => performance.now();\n\n// Canvas and DOM elements\nconst cv = document.getElementById('cv');\nconst ctx = cv.getContext('2d', { alpha: false });\nconst W = cv.width, H = cv.height;\nconst msgEl = document.getElementById('msg');\nconst btnEl = document.getElementById('btn');\nconst hudEl = document.getElementById('hud');\nconst pauseBtnEl = document.getElementById('pauseBtn');\nconst gamePausedOverlayEl = document.getElementById('gamePausedOverlay');\nconst questionModalEl = document.getElementById('questionModal');\nconst qTextEl = document.getElementById('qText');\nconst qOptionsContainerEl = document.getElementById('qOptionsContainer');\nconst qFeedbackEl = document.getElementById('qFeedback');\n\n// Initialize accent color\n(() => {\n  const accents = [\n    '--accent-neon-cyan', '--accent-neon-magenta', '--accent-neon-lime',\n    '--accent-neon-orange', '--accent-neon-yellow', '--accent-neon-electricblue'\n  ];\n  const chosenAccent = accents[Math.floor(Math.random() * accents.length)];\n  const accentValue = getComputedStyle(document.documentElement).getPropertyValue(chosenAccent).trim();\n  document.documentElement.style.setProperty('--accent', accentValue);\n  document.documentElement.style.setProperty('--player-fill', accentValue);\n  document.documentElement.style.setProperty('--player-glow', accentValue);\n})();\n\n// Game constants with improved physics\nconst PLAYER_W = 20, PLAYER_H = 20;\nconst PLAYER_SPEED = 4;\nconst PLAYER_JUMP_POWER = 11;\nconst GRAVITY = 0.45;\nconst TERMINAL_VELOCITY = 12;\nconst GROUND_Y = H - 60;\nconst BLOCK_W = 28, BLOCK_H = 28;\nconst COIN_SIZE = 14;\nconst KEY_ICON_SIZE_FACTOR = 0.7;\nconst NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS = 8;\nconst PLATFORM_MIN_W = 90;\nconst PLATFORM_MAX_W = 160;\nconst PLATFORM_H = 16;\nconst X_GAP_MIN = 50;\nconst X_GAP_MAX = 110;\nconst Y_CHANGE_MAX = 50;\nconst MIN_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_TOP = H * 0.25;\nconst MAX_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_GROUND = GROUND_Y - PLATFORM_H - BLOCK_H - PLAYER_H - 20;\nconst INITIAL_PLATFORM_X_START = 140;\nconst COIN_SPIN_SPEED = 0.08;\n\n// Game state\nlet gameState = {\n  playing: false,\n  isPaused: false,\n  score: 0,\n  lives: 3,\n  timeLeft: 120,\n  spawnFire: false,\n  doubleJump: false,\n  lastFrameTime: 0,\n  deltaTime: 0\n};\n\nlet player, platforms, enemies, coins, blocks, goal, camX, timerInt;\nlet keys = {}, projectiles = [], bgStars = [], particles = [];\nlet currentBlockInteracting = null;\n\n// Touch controls\nlet touchState = {\n  touches: {},\n  leftTouchId: null,\n  rightTouchId: null\n};\n\nconst SWIPE_THRESHOLD = 30;\nconst SWIPE_TIME_THRESHOLD = 400;\nconst TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO = 0.4;\n\n// Utility functions\nconst getCSSVar = varName => getComputedStyle(document.documentElement).getPropertyValue(varName).trim();\nconst rand = (a, b) => Math.random() * (b - a) + a;\nconst randInt = (a, b) => Math.floor(rand(a, b + 1));\nconst lerp = (a, b, t) => a + (b - a) * t;\nconst clamp = (val, min, max) => Math.max(min, Math.min(max, val));\n\n// Collision detection with improved accuracy\nfunction collide(a, b) {\n  return a.x < b.x + b.w &&\n         a.x + a.w > b.x &&\n         a.y < b.y + b.h &&\n         a.y + a.h > b.y;\n}\n\n// Enhanced particle system\nclass Particle {\n  constructor(x, y, vx, vy, color, life) {\n    this.x = x;\n    this.y = y;\n    this.vx = vx;\n    this.vy = vy;\n    this.color = color;\n    this.life = life;\n    this.maxLife = life;\n    this.size = rand(2, 6);\n  }\n\n  update(dt) {\n    this.x += this.vx * dt;\n    this.y += this.vy * dt;\n    this.vy += GRAVITY * 0.5 * dt;\n    this.life -= dt;\n    this.vx *= 0.98;\n  }\n\n  draw() {\n    const alpha = Math.max(0, this.life / this.maxLife);\n    ctx.globalAlpha = alpha;\n    ctx.fillStyle = this.color;\n    ctx.shadowColor = this.color;\n    ctx.shadowBlur = 10;\n    ctx.fillRect(this.x - camX - this.size/2, this.y - this.size/2, this.size, this.size);\n    ctx.shadowBlur = 0;\n    ctx.globalAlpha = 1;\n  }\n}\n\n// Background stars with parallax\nfunction initBackgroundStars(numStars = 150) {\n  bgStars = [];\n  for (let i = 0; i < numStars; i++) {\n    bgStars.push({\n      x: Math.random() * W,\n      y: Math.random() * H,\n      radius: rand(0.5, 2),\n      alpha: rand(0.3, 0.9),\n      parallax: rand(0.05, 0.3),\n      twinkle: rand(0, Math.PI * 2)\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nfunction drawBackground() {\n  // Gradient background\n  const gradient = ctx.createLinearGradient(0, 0, 0, H);\n  gradient.addColorStop(0, '#0a0a0f');\n  gradient.addColorStop(1, '#1a1a2e');\n  ctx.fillStyle = gradient;\n  ctx.fillRect(0, 0, W, H);\n\n  // Draw stars with twinkle effect\n  bgStars.forEach(star => {\n    star.twinkle += 0.02;\n    const twinkleAlpha = Math.sin(star.twinkle) * 0.3 + 0.7;\n    const xPos = (star.x - camX * star.parallax + W * 2) % W;\n    \n    ctx.beginPath();\n    ctx.arc(xPos, star.y, star.radius, 0, Math.PI * 2);\n    ctx.fillStyle = '#ffffff';\n    ctx.globalAlpha = star.alpha * twinkleAlpha;\n    ctx.fill();\n  });\n  ctx.globalAlpha = 1;\n\n  // Grid effect\n  ctx.strokeStyle = 'rgba(0, 229, 255, 0.03)';\n  ctx.lineWidth = 1;\n  for (let i = 0; i < H; i += 40) {\n    ctx.beginPath();\n    ctx.moveTo(0, i);\n    ctx.lineTo(W, i);\n    ctx.stroke();\n  }\n  \n  const firstVisibleWorldX = Math.floor(camX / 40) * 40;\n  const lastVisibleWorldX = Math.ceil((camX + W) / 40) * 40;\n  for (let worldX = firstVisibleWorldX; worldX <= lastVisibleWorldX; worldX += 40) {\n    const screenX = worldX - camX;\n    ctx.beginPath();\n    ctx.moveTo(screenX, 0);\n    ctx.lineTo(screenX, H);\n    ctx.stroke();\n  }\n}\n\n// Enhanced level generation\nfunction buildLevel() {\n  // Reset game objects\n  player = {\n    x: 50,\n    y: GROUND_Y - PLAYER_H - 10,\n    w: PLAYER_W,\n    h: PLAYER_H,\n    vx: 0,\n    vy: 0,\n    onGround: false,\n    jumps: 0,\n    angle: 0,\n    trail: []\n  };\n\n  platforms = [];\n  coins = [];\n  enemies = [];\n  blocks = [];\n  particles = [];\n\n  // Create ground\n  const groundWidth = INITIAL_PLATFORM_X_START + (NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS + 3) * (PLATFORM_MAX_W + X_GAP_MAX) + 200;\n  platforms.push({\n    x: -100,\n    y: GROUND_Y,\n    w: groundWidth,\n    h: 60,\n    type: 'ground'\n  });\n\n  // Generate platforms with improved spacing\n  let currentX = INITIAL_PLATFORM_X_START;\n  let previousY = GROUND_Y - rand(40, 80);\n  previousY = clamp(previousY, MIN_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_TOP, MAX_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_GROUND);\n\n  const blockInterval = Math.max(1, Math.floor(NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS / Q.length));\n  let nextBlockIndex = randInt(0, 1);\n  let qBlockIndex = 0;\n\n  for (let i = 0; i < NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS; i++) {\n    const pWidth = rand(PLATFORM_MIN_W, PLATFORM_MAX_W);\n    let pY = previousY + rand(-Y_CHANGE_MAX, Y_CHANGE_MAX * 0.7);\n    pY = clamp(pY, MIN_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_TOP, MAX_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_GROUND);\n\n    const platform = {\n      x: currentX,\n      y: pY,\n      w: pWidth,\n      h: PLATFORM_H,\n      type: 'normal'\n    };\n    platforms.push(platform);\n\n    // Place question blocks\n    if (i === nextBlockIndex && qBlockIndex < Q.length) {\n      blocks.push({\n        x: platform.x + platform.w / 2 - BLOCK_W / 2,\n        y: platform.y - BLOCK_H,\n        w: BLOCK_W,\n        h: BLOCK_H,\n        state: '?',\n        qID: qBlockIndex,\n        bounce: 0\n      });\n      qBlockIndex++;\n      nextBlockIndex += blockInterval + randInt(0, 1);\n    }\n    // Place enemies\n    else if (Math.random() < 0.35) {\n      const enemyType = Math.random() < 0.6 ? 'mite' : 'golem';\n      const enemySize = enemyType === 'mite' ? 20 : 26;\n      enemies.push({\n        x: platform.x + rand(10, platform.w - enemySize - 10),\n        y: platform.y - enemySize,\n        w: enemySize,\n        h: enemySize,\n        dir: Math.random() < 0.5 ? 1 : -1,\n        type: enemyType,\n        speed: enemyType === 'mite' ? 1.5 : 0.8,\n        patrolMinX: platform.x,\n        patrolMaxX: platform.x + platform.w - enemySize,\n        animFrame: 0\n      });\n    }\n\n    // Place coins\n    const numCoins = randInt(1, 3);\n    for (let j = 0; j < numCoins; j++) {\n      coins.push({\n        x: platform.x + rand(COIN_SIZE, platform.w - COIN_SIZE * 2),\n        y: platform.y - PLATFORM_H - rand(20, 60),\n        w: COIN_SIZE,\n        h: COIN_SIZE,\n        collected: false,\n        angle: rand(0, Math.PI * 2),\n        spinSpeed: COIN_SPIN_SPEED,\n        floatY: 0\n      });\n    }\n\n    previousY = pY;\n    currentX += pWidth + rand(X_GAP_MIN, X_GAP_MAX);\n  }\n\n  // Create goal platform\n  const lastPlatform = platforms[platforms.length - 1];\n  const goalX = lastPlatform.x + lastPlatform.w + rand(80, 120);\n  const goalY = GROUND_Y - rand(80, 120);\n  \n  platforms.push({\n    x: goalX,\n    y: goalY,\n    w: 120,\n    h: PLATFORM_H,\n    type: 'goal_platform'\n  });\n\n  goal = {\n    x: goalX + 60 - 25,\n    y: goalY - 70,\n    w: 50,\n    h: 70,\n    isLocked: true,\n    pulse: 0\n  };\n\n  // Initialize game state\n  camX = 0;\n  gameState.score = 0;\n  gameState.lives = 3;\n  gameState.timeLeft = 120;\n  gameState.spawnFire = false;\n  gameState.doubleJump = false;\n  projectiles = [];\n  \n  initBackgroundStars();\n  updateGoalLockState();\n  updateHUD();\n}\n\n// Questions data\nconst Q = [\n{\n\"qID\": 0,\n\"q\": \"What was Brandon Kohrt's original career path before he transitioned into global mental health?\",\n\"options\": [\n{ \"text\": \"A humanitarian aid worker for the UN\", \"correct\": false },\n{ \"text\": \"A documentary filmmaker in Nepal\", \"correct\": true },\n{ \"text\": \"An anthropologist studying rural cultures\", \"correct\": false }\n],\n\"feedbackCorrect\": \"✅ Correct! He began his career behind a camera, documenting the reintegration of child soldiers in Nepal, which sparked his focus on mental health.\",\n\"feedbackIncorrect\": \"❌ Not quite. The article states he started as a documentary filmmaker, and his experiences in Nepal led him to pursue studies in anthropology and psychiatry later.\",\n\"power\": \"double\"\n},\n{\n\"qID\": 1,\n\"q\": \"What is the core principle of 'task-sharing,' a strategy Dr. Kohrt champions for expanding mental health care?\",\n\"options\": [\n{ \"text\": \"Training non-specialist community members to provide front-line care.\", \"correct\": true },\n{ \"text\": \"Using digital apps to replace human therapists entirely.\", \"correct\": false },\n{ \"text\": \"Building more advanced psychiatric hospitals in capital cities.\", \"correct\": false }\n],\n\"feedbackCorrect\": \"✅ Exactly! EQUIP is a digital platform designed to monitor and enhance counselor competencies, ensuring that as care scales up, its quality remains high.\",\n\"feedbackIncorrect\": \"❌ Not quite. EQUIP is a tool for training and supervising providers to ensure quality, not for delivering therapy directly to patients.\",\n\"power\": \"both\"\n}\n];\n\n// Enhanced drawing functions\nfunction drawPlayer() {\n  const x = player.x - camX;\n  const y = player.y;\n  \n  // Draw trail effect when moving\n  if (Math.abs(player.vx) > 0.1) {\n    player.trail.push({ x: player.x + player.w/2, y: player.y + player.h/2, life: 10 });\n  }\n  \n  player.trail = player.trail.filter(t => {\n    t.life--;\n    if (t.life > 0) {\n      ctx.globalAlpha = t.life / 20;\n      ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--player-glow');\n      ctx.fillRect(t.x - camX - 2, t.y - 2, 4, 4);\n      return true;\n    }\n    return false;\n  });\n  \n  ctx.globalAlpha = 1;\n  \n  // Draw player with rotation when jumping\n  ctx.save();\n  ctx.translate(x + player.w/2, y + player.h/2);\n  \n  if (!player.onGround) {\n    ctx.rotate(player.angle);\n  }\n  \n  // Player shadow\n  ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--player-glow');\n  ctx.shadowBlur = 15;\n  \n  // Player body\n  ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--player-fill');\n  ctx.fillRect(-player.w/2, -player.h/2, player.w, player.h);\n  \n  // Player outline\n  ctx.strokeStyle = getCSSVar('--player-glow');\n  ctx.lineWidth = 2;\n  ctx.strokeRect(-player.w/2, -player.h/2, player.w, player.h);\n  \n  ctx.restore();\n  ctx.shadowBlur = 0;\n}\n\nfunction drawPlatform(p) {\n  const x = p.x - camX;\n  \n  // Platform gradient\n  const gradient = ctx.createLinearGradient(x, p.y, x, p.y + p.h);\n  gradient.addColorStop(0, getCSSVar('--platform-highlight'));\n  gradient.addColorStop(1, getCSSVar('--platform-fill'));\n  \n  ctx.fillStyle = gradient;\n  ctx.fillRect(x, p.y, p.w, p.h);\n  \n  // Platform edge highlight\n  ctx.strokeStyle = getCSSVar('--platform-outline');\n  ctx.lineWidth = 2;\n  ctx.strokeRect(x, p.y, p.w, p.h);\n  \n  // Top highlight\n  ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--platform-highlight');\n  ctx.globalAlpha = 0.6;\n  ctx.fillRect(x, p.y, p.w, 4);\n  ctx.globalAlpha = 1;\n}\n\nfunction drawCoin(c) {\n  if (c.collected) return;\n  \n  const x = c.x - camX + c.w/2;\n  const y = c.y + c.h/2 + Math.sin(now() * 0.003 + c.x) * 3;\n  \n  ctx.save();\n  ctx.translate(x, y);\n  ctx.rotate(c.angle);\n  \n  // Coin glow\n  ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--coin-glow');\n  ctx.shadowBlur = 20;\n  \n  // Coin body with 3D effect\n  const scale = Math.abs(Math.cos(c.angle));\n  ctx.scale(scale, 1);\n  \n  ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--coin-fill');\n  ctx.beginPath();\n  ctx.arc(0, 0, c.w/2, 0, Math.PI * 2);\n  ctx.fill();\n  \n  // Inner circle\n  ctx.fillStyle = 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.3)';\n  ctx.beginPath();\n  ctx.arc(0, 0, c.w/3, 0, Math.PI * 2);\n  ctx.fill();\n  \n  ctx.restore();\n  ctx.shadowBlur = 0;\n}\n\nfunction drawBlock(b) {\n  const x = b.x - camX;\n  const y = b.y + Math.sin(now() * 0.005 + b.x) * 2;\n  \n  let fillColor = getCSSVar('--block-used-fill');\n  let glowColor = null;\n  \n  if (b.state === '?' || b.state === 'asking') {\n    fillColor = getCSSVar('--block-active-fill');\n    glowColor = getCSSVar('--block-active-glow');\n    b.bounce = Math.sin(now() * 0.01) * 3;\n  } else if (b.state === 'used_correctly') {\n    fillColor = getCSSVar('--block-correct-fill');\n    glowColor = getCSSVar('--block-correct-fill');\n  }\n  \n  // Block shadow\n  if (glowColor) {\n    ctx.shadowColor = glowColor;\n    ctx.shadowBlur = 20;\n  }\n  \n  // Block body with gradient\n  const gradient = ctx.createLinearGradient(x, y, x + b.w, y + b.h);\n  gradient.addColorStop(0, fillColor);\n  gradient.addColorStop(1, 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3)');\n  \n  ctx.fillStyle = gradient;\n  ctx.fillRect(x, y + b.bounce, b.w, b.h);\n  \n  // Block outline\n  ctx.strokeStyle = glowColor || 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)';\n  ctx.lineWidth = 2;\n  ctx.strokeRect(x, y + b.bounce, b.w, b.h);\n  \n  // Draw key icon\n  if (b.state === '?' || b.state === 'asking') {\n    drawKeyIcon(x + b.w/2, y + b.h/2 + b.bounce, b.w * KEY_ICON_SIZE_FACTOR);\n  }\n  \n  ctx.shadowBlur = 0;\n}\n\nfunction drawKeyIcon(cx, cy, size) {\n  const headRadius = size * 0.35;\n  const stemLength = size * 0.7;\n  const stemWidth = size * 0.18;\n  \n  ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--block-key-color');\n  ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--block-key-color');\n  ctx.shadowBlur = 10;\n  \n  // Key head\n  ctx.beginPath();\n  ctx.arc(cx, cy - stemLength/3, headRadius, 0, Math.PI * 2);\n  ctx.fill();\n  \n  // Key stem\n  ctx.fillRect(cx - stemWidth/2, cy - stemLength/3, stemWidth, stemLength);\n  \n  // Key teeth\n  ctx.fillRect(cx + stemWidth/2, cy + stemLength/3, stemWidth * 0.8, stemWidth * 0.6);\n  ctx.fillRect(cx + stemWidth/2, cy + stemLength/3 - stemWidth, stemWidth * 0.8, stemWidth * 0.6);\n  \n  ctx.shadowBlur = 0;\n}\n\nfunction drawEnemy(e) {\n  if (e.dead) return;\n  \n  const x = e.x - camX;\n  const y = e.y;\n  \n  e.animFrame += 0.1;\n  const bobY = Math.sin(e.animFrame) * 2;\n  \n  ctx.save();\n  \n  if (e.type === 'mite') {\n    // Animated triangle enemy\n    ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--enemy-mite-fill');\n    ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--enemy-mite-glow');\n    ctx.shadowBlur = 15;\n    \n    ctx.translate(x + e.w/2, y + e.h/2 + bobY);\n    ctx.rotate(Math.sin(e.animFrame * 0.5) * 0.1);\n    \n    ctx.beginPath();\n    ctx.moveTo(0, -e.h/2);\n    ctx.lineTo(e.w/2, e.h/2);\n    ctx.lineTo(-e.w/2, e.h/2);\n    ctx.closePath();\n    ctx.fill();\n    \n    // Eyes\n    ctx.fillStyle = '#fff';\n    ctx.fillRect(-4, -2, 3, 3);\n    ctx.fillRect(1, -2, 3, 3);\n  } else {\n    // Golem enemy with animation\n    ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--enemy-golem-fill');\n    ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--enemy-golem-glow');\n    ctx.shadowBlur = 20;\n    \n    const squashY = 1 + Math.sin(e.animFrame * 2) * 0.05;\n    ctx.translate(x + e.w/2, y + e.h + bobY);\n    ctx.scale(1, squashY);\n    \n    ctx.fillRect(-e.w/2, -e.h, e.w, e.h);\n    \n    // Golem details\n    ctx.fillStyle = 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3)';\n    ctx.fillRect(-e.w/2 + 4, -e.h + 4, e.w - 8, 4);\n    ctx.fillRect(-e.w/2 + 4, -e.h/2, e.w - 8, 4);\n  }\n  \n  ctx.restore();\n  ctx.shadowBlur = 0;\n}\n\nfunction drawProjectile(p) {\n  const x = p.x - camX;\n  const y = p.y;\n  \n  // Projectile trail\n  for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {\n    ctx.globalAlpha = 0.3 - i * 0.1;\n    ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--projectile-glow');\n    ctx.fillRect(x - p.vx * i * 2, y, p.w - i, p.h - i);\n  }\n  \n  ctx.globalAlpha = 1;\n  \n  // Projectile body\n  ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--projectile-fill');\n  ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--projectile-glow');\n  ctx.shadowBlur = 15;\n  \n  ctx.beginPath();\n  ctx.arc(x + p.w/2, y + p.h/2, p.w/2, 0, Math.PI * 2);\n  ctx.fill();\n  \n  ctx.shadowBlur = 0;\n}\n\nfunction drawGoal() {\n  const x = goal.x - camX;\n  const y = goal.y;\n  \n  goal.pulse += 0.05;\n  const pulseSize = Math.sin(goal.pulse) * 5;\n  \n  if (goal.isLocked) {\n    // Locked portal\n    ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--goal-locked-fill');\n    ctx.fillRect(x, y, goal.w, goal.h);\n    \n    ctx.strokeStyle = '#666';\n    ctx.lineWidth = 3;\n    ctx.strokeRect(x, y, goal.w, goal.h);\n    \n    // Lock icon\n    ctx.fillStyle = '#888';\n    ctx.font = `bold ${goal.h * 0.5}px ${getCSSVar('--font')}`;\n    ctx.textAlign = 'center';\n    ctx.textBaseline = 'middle';\n    ctx.fillText('🔒', x + goal.w/2, y + goal.h/2);\n  } else {\n    // Unlocked portal with effects\n    ctx.save();\n    \n    // Portal glow\n    ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--goal-glow');\n    ctx.shadowBlur = 30 + pulseSize;\n    \n    // Portal gradient\n    const gradient = ctx.createRadialGradient(\n      x + goal.w/2, y + goal.h/2, 0,\n      x + goal.w/2, y + goal.h/2, goal.w/2\n    );\n    gradient.addColorStop(0, getCSSVar('--goal-portal-accent'));\n    gradient.addColorStop(0.5, getCSSVar('--goal-fill'));\n    gradient.addColorStop(1, 'rgba(0, 212, 255, 0.3)');\n    \n    ctx.fillStyle = gradient;\n    ctx.fillRect(x - pulseSize/2, y - pulseSize/2, goal.w + pulseSize, goal.h + pulseSize);\n    \n    // Portal swirl effect\n    ctx.strokeStyle = getCSSVar('--goal-portal-accent');\n    ctx.lineWidth = 2;\n    ctx.globalAlpha = 0.7;\n    \n    for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {\n      ctx.beginPath();\n      const angle = goal.pulse + i * Math.PI * 2/3;\n      const radius = goal.w/3;\n      ctx.arc(\n        x + goal.w/2 + Math.cos(angle) * radius,\n        y + goal.h/2 + Math.sin(angle) * radius,\n        5, 0, Math.PI * 2\n      );\n      ctx.stroke();\n    }\n    \n    ctx.restore();\n  }\n  \n  ctx.shadowBlur = 0;\n  ctx.textAlign = 'left';\n  ctx.textBaseline = 'alphabetic';\n}\n\n// Main game loop with delta time\nfunction gameLoop(currentTime) {\n  if (!gameState.playing || gameState.isPaused) {\n    if (gameState.isPaused && gameState.playing) {\n      draw();\n      gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'flex';\n    }\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  // Calculate delta time for smooth physics\n  if (!gameState.lastFrameTime) gameState.lastFrameTime = currentTime;\n  gameState.deltaTime = Math.min((currentTime - gameState.lastFrameTime) / 16.67, 2);\n  gameState.lastFrameTime = currentTime;\n  \n  update(gameState.deltaTime);\n  draw();\n  \n  RAF(gameLoop);\n}\n\n// Enhanced update function\nfunction update(dt) {\n  if (!gameState.playing || gameState.isPaused) return;\n  \n  // Player movement with smooth acceleration\n  const targetVx = keys['ArrowRight'] ? PLAYER_SPEED : (keys['ArrowLeft'] ? -PLAYER_SPEED : 0);\n  player.vx = lerp(player.vx, targetVx, 0.2 * dt);\n  \n  // Boundary checks\n  const minX = platforms[0] ? platforms[0].x : 0;\n  const maxX = platforms[0] ? platforms[0].x + platforms[0].w - player.w : W;\n  \n  if (player.x <= minX && player.vx < 0) {\n    player.x = minX;\n    player.vx = 0;\n  } else if (player.x >= maxX && player.vx > 0) {\n    player.x = maxX;\n    player.vx = 0;\n  }\n  \n  // Jumping with double jump\n  if (keys['Space'] && (player.onGround || (gameState.doubleJump && player.jumps < 2))) {\n    player.vy = -PLAYER_JUMP_POWER;\n    player.onGround = false;\n    player.jumps++;\n    keys['Space'] = false;\n    \n    // Jump particles\n    for (let i = 0; i < 5; i++) {\n      particles.push(new Particle(\n        player.x + player.w/2,\n        player.y + player.h,\n        rand(-2, 2),\n        rand(-2, -5),\n        getCSSVar('--player-glow'),\n        30\n      ));\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Apply physics\n  player.vy += GRAVITY * dt;\n  player.vy = Math.min(player.vy, TERMINAL_VELOCITY);\n  \n  player.x += player.vx * dt;\n  player.y += player.vy * dt;\n  \n  // Rotation when airborne\n  if (!player.onGround) {\n    player.angle += player.vx * 0.02 * dt;\n  } else {\n    player.angle = lerp(player.angle, 0, 0.3 * dt);\n  }\n  \n  // Platform collision with improved detection\n  player.onGround = false;\n  platforms.forEach(p => {\n    if (collide(player, p)) {\n      const playerBottom = player.y + player.h;\n      const playerTop = player.y;\n      const playerLeft = player.x;\n      const playerRight = player.x + player.w;\n      \n      const platTop = p.y;\n      const platBottom = p.y + p.h;\n      const platLeft = p.x;\n      const platRight = p.x + p.w;\n      \n      const prevPlayerBottom = playerBottom - player.vy * dt;\n      const prevPlayerTop = playerTop - player.vy * dt;\n      const prevPlayerLeft = playerLeft - player.vx * dt;\n      const prevPlayerRight = playerRight - player.vx * dt;\n      \n      // Landing on platform\n      if (player.vy >= 0 && prevPlayerBottom <= platTop + 5) {\n        player.y = platTop - player.h;\n        player.vy = 0;\n        player.onGround = true;\n        player.jumps = 0;\n      }\n      // Hitting platform from below\n      else if (player.vy < 0 && prevPlayerTop >= platBottom - 5) {\n        player.y = platBottom;\n        player.vy = 1;\n      }\n      // Side collisions\n      else if (prevPlayerRight <= platLeft + 5 && player.vx > 0) {\n        player.x = platLeft - player.w;\n        player.vx = 0;\n      } else if (prevPlayerLeft >= platRight - 5 && player.vx < 0) {\n        player.x = platRight;\n        player.vx = 0;\n      }\n    }\n  });\n  \n  // Fall death\n  if (player.y > H + player.h * 2) {\n    loseLife();\n  }\n  \n  // Block interactions\n  blocks.forEach(b => {\n    if (collide(player, b) && b.state === '?' && gameState.playing && !gameState.isPaused) {\n      b.state = 'asking';\n      currentBlockInteracting = b;\n      player.vx = 0;\n      \n      const questionData = Q.find(q => q.qID === b.qID);\n      if (questionData) {\n        showQuestionModal(questionData);\n      }\n    }\n  });\n  \n  // Enemy AI and collisions\n  enemies.forEach(e => {\n    if (e.dead) return;\n    \n    // Enemy movement\n    e.x += e.dir * e.speed * dt;\n    \n    // Patrol boundaries\n    if (e.x <= e.patrolMinX || e.x + e.w >= e.patrolMaxX) {\n      e.dir *= -1;\n      e.x = clamp(e.x, e.patrolMinX, e.patrolMaxX - e.w);\n    }\n    \n    // Player collision\n    if (collide(player, e)) {\n      if (player.vy > 0 && player.y + player.h - player.vy * dt <= e.y + 5) {\n        // Stomp enemy\n        player.vy = -8;\n        gameState.score += 10;\n        e.dead = true;\n        \n        // Enemy defeat particles\n        for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {\n          particles.push(new Particle(\n            e.x + e.w/2,\n            e.y + e.h/2,\n            rand(-3, 3),\n            rand(-3, -6),\n            e.type === 'mite' ? getCSSVar('--enemy-mite-fill') : getCSSVar('--enemy-golem-fill'),\n            40\n          ));\n        }\n      } else {\n        loseLife();\n      }\n    }\n  });\n  \n  // Projectile firing\n  if (gameState.spawnFire && keys['KeyF'] && projectiles.length < 3) {\n    const now = Date.now();\n    if (!projectiles.lastFireTime || now - projectiles.lastFireTime > 300) {\n      const dir = player.vx >= 0 ? 1 : -1;\n      projectiles.push({\n        x: player.x + (dir > 0 ? player.w : -10),\n        y: player.y + player.h/2 - 5,\n        vx: 8 * dir,\n        vy: 0,\n        w: 10,\n        h: 10\n      });\n      projectiles.lastFireTime = now;\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Update projectiles\n  projectiles = projectiles.filter(p => {\n    p.x += p.vx * dt;\n    \n    // Check enemy hits\n    enemies.forEach(e => {\n      if (!e.dead && collide(p, e)) {\n        e.dead = true;\n        p.hit = true;\n        gameState.score += 15;\n        \n        // Hit particles\n        for (let i = 0; i < 6; i++) {\n          particles.push(new Particle(\n            e.x + e.w/2,\n            e.y + e.h/2,\n            rand(-4, 4),\n            rand(-4, -7),\n            getCSSVar('--projectile-glow'),\n            35\n          ));\n        }\n      }\n    });\n    \n    // Remove off-screen projectiles\n    if (p.x < camX - 50 || p.x > camX + W + 50) {\n      p.hit = true;\n    }\n    \n    return !p.hit;\n  });\n  \n  // Coin collection\n  coins.forEach(c => {\n    if (!c.collected) {\n      c.angle += c.spinSpeed * dt;\n      \n      if (collide(player, c)) {\n        c.collected = true;\n        gameState.score += 10;\n        \n        // Coin particles\n        for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {\n          particles.push(new Particle(\n            c.x + c.w/2,\n            c.y + c.h/2,\n            rand(-3, 3),\n            rand(-3, -6),\n            getCSSVar('--coin-fill'),\n            30\n          ));\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  });\n  \n  // Update particles\n  particles = particles.filter(p => {\n    p.update(dt);\n    return p.life > 0;\n  });\n  \n  // Goal check\n  updateGoalLockState();\n  if (!goal.isLocked && collide(player, goal)) {\n    win();\n  }\n  \n  // Camera smoothing\n  const targetCamX = player.x - W/3;\n  const minCamX = platforms[0] ? platforms[0].x : 0;\n  const maxCamX = platforms[0] ? Math.max(0, platforms[0].x + platforms[0].w - W) : 0;\n  \n  const desiredCamX = clamp(targetCamX, minCamX, maxCamX);\n  camX = lerp(camX, desiredCamX, 0.1 * dt);\n  \n  updateHUD();\n}\n\n// Main draw function\nfunction draw() {\n  drawBackground();\n  \n  // Draw platforms\n  platforms.forEach(p => drawPlatform(p));\n  \n  // Draw coins\n  coins.forEach(c => drawCoin(c));\n  \n  // Draw blocks\n  blocks.forEach(b => drawBlock(b));\n  \n  // Draw enemies\n  enemies.forEach(e => drawEnemy(e));\n  \n  // Draw projectiles\n  projectiles.forEach(p => drawProjectile(p));\n  \n  // Draw particles\n  particles.forEach(p => p.draw());\n  \n  // Draw player\n  drawPlayer();\n  \n  // Draw goal\n  drawGoal();\n}\n\n// Game state management\nfunction updateGoalLockState() {\n  goal.isLocked = !blocks.every(b => b.state === 'used_correctly');\n}\n\nfunction updateHUD() {\n  hudEl.textContent = `Score: ${gameState.score} | Lives: ${gameState.lives} | Time: ${gameState.timeLeft}s`;\n}\n\nfunction loseLife() {\n  gameState.lives--;\n  updateHUD();\n  \n  if (gameState.lives <= 0) {\n    gameOver();\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  // Respawn player\n  player.x = Math.max(50, player.x - W/3);\n  player.y = GROUND_Y - PLAYER_H - 80;\n  player.vx = 0;\n  player.vy = -3;\n  player.angle = 0;\n  player.trail = [];\n  \n  // Death particles\n  for (let i = 0; i < 20; i++) {\n    particles.push(new Particle(\n      player.x + player.w/2,\n      player.y + player.h/2,\n      rand(-5, 5),\n      rand(-5, -10),\n      getCSSVar('--accent-neon-magenta'),\n      50\n    ));\n  }\n}\n\nfunction win() {\n  gameState.playing = false;\n  gameState.isPaused = false;\n  pauseBtnEl.style.display = 'none';\n  gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'none';\n  msgEl.textContent = '🎉 LEVEL COMPLETE! 🎉';\n  msgEl.className = 'win-message';\n  confetti(200, true);\n  btnEl.style.display = 'inline-block';\n  btnEl.textContent = 'Play Again';\n  clearInterval(timerInt);\n}\n\nfunction gameOver() {\n  gameState.playing = false;\n  gameState.isPaused = false;\n  pauseBtnEl.style.display = 'none';\n  gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'none';\n  msgEl.textContent = '💀 GAME OVER 💀';\n  msgEl.className = 'game-over-message';\n  btnEl.style.display = 'inline-block';\n  btnEl.textContent = 'Try Again';\n  clearInterval(timerInt);\n}\n\nfunction startGame() {\n  buildLevel();\n  gameState.playing = true;\n  gameState.isPaused = false;\n  msgEl.textContent = '';\n  msgEl.className = '';\n  btnEl.style.display = 'none';\n  pauseBtnEl.style.display = 'inline-block';\n  pauseBtnEl.textContent = 'Pause';\n  gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'none';\n  \n  clearInterval(timerInt);\n  timerInt = setInterval(() => {\n    if (!gameState.playing || gameState.isPaused || questionModalEl.classList.contains('visible')) return;\n    \n    gameState.timeLeft--;\n    updateHUD();\n    \n    if (gameState.timeLeft <= 0) {\n      gameOver();\n    }\n  }, 1000);\n  \n  RAF(gameLoop);\n}\n\nfunction togglePause() {\n  if (!gameState.playing) return;\n  \n  gameState.isPaused = !gameState.isPaused;\n  \n  if (gameState.isPaused) {\n    pauseBtnEl.textContent = 'Resume';\n    gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'flex';\n  } else {\n    pauseBtnEl.textContent = 'Pause';\n    gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'none';\n    RAF(gameLoop);\n  }\n}\n\n// Question modal functions\nfunction showQuestionModal(questionData) {\n  gameState.isPaused = true;\n  gameState.playing = false;\n  \n  qTextEl.textContent = questionData.q;\n  qOptionsContainerEl.innerHTML = '';\n  qFeedbackEl.textContent = '';\n  qFeedbackEl.className = '';\n  \n  questionData.options.forEach(opt => {\n    const button = document.createElement('button');\n    button.type = 'button';\n    button.textContent = opt.text;\n    button.onclick = () => handleAnswerSelection(opt, questionData);\n    qOptionsContainerEl.appendChild(button);\n  });\n  \n  questionModalEl.classList.add('visible');\n}\n\nfunction handleAnswerSelection(selectedOption, questionData) {\n  Array.from(qOptionsContainerEl.children).forEach(btn => btn.disabled = true);\n  \n  if (selectedOption.correct) {\n    qFeedbackEl.textContent = questionData.feedbackCorrect;\n    qFeedbackEl.className = 'correct';\n    gameState.score += 50;\n    \n    if (currentBlockInteracting) {\n      currentBlockInteracting.state = 'used_correctly';\n    }\n    \n    // Grant power-ups\n    if (questionData.power === 'double') {\n      gameState.doubleJump = true;\n    } else if (questionData.power === 'fire') {\n      gameState.spawnFire = true;\n    } else if (questionData.power === 'both') {\n      gameState.doubleJump = true;\n      gameState.spawnFire = true;\n    }\n    \n    // Success particles\n    for (let i = 0; i < 15; i++) {\n      particles.push(new Particle(\n        player.x + player.w/2,\n        player.y,\n        rand(-4, 4),\n        rand(-4, -8),\n        getCSSVar('--accent-neon-lime'),\n        60\n      ));\n    }\n  } else {\n    qFeedbackEl.textContent = questionData.feedbackIncorrect;\n    qFeedbackEl.className = 'incorrect';\n    \n    if (currentBlockInteracting) {\n      currentBlockInteracting.state = '?';\n    }\n    \n    loseLife();\n  }\n  \n  updateHUD();\n  updateGoalLockState();\n  \n  setTimeout(() => {\n    questionModalEl.classList.remove('visible');\n    currentBlockInteracting = null;\n    gameState.playing = true;\n    gameState.isPaused = false;\n    \n    if (gameState.lives > 0 && gameState.timeLeft > 0) {\n      RAF(gameLoop);\n    }\n  }, 2500);\n}\n\n// Event listeners\ndocument.addEventListener('keydown', e => {\n  keys[e.code] = true;\n  if (e.code === 'Space' || e.code.startsWith('Arrow')) {\n    e.preventDefault();\n  }\n  if (e.code === 'KeyP' && gameState.playing) {\n    togglePause();\n  }\n});\n\ndocument.addEventListener('keyup', e => {\n  keys[e.code] = false;\n});\n\nbtnEl.onclick = startGame;\npauseBtnEl.onclick = togglePause;\n\n// Touch controls\ncv.addEventListener('touchstart', handleTouchStart, { passive: false });\ncv.addEventListener('touchmove', handleTouchMove, { passive: false });\ncv.addEventListener('touchend', handleTouchEnd, { passive: false });\n\nfunction handleTouchStart(event) {\n  if (!gameState.playing || gameState.isPaused || questionModalEl.classList.contains('visible')) return;\n  event.preventDefault();\n  \n  const rect = cv.getBoundingClientRect();\n  \n  for (let touch of event.changedTouches) {\n    const x = touch.clientX - rect.left;\n    const relativeX = x / rect.width;\n    \n    touchState.touches[touch.identifier] = {\n      startX: touch.clientX,\n      startY: touch.clientY,\n      startTime: now(),\n      relativeX: relativeX\n    };\n    \n    if (relativeX < TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO) {\n      keys['ArrowLeft'] = true;\n      touchState.leftTouchId = touch.identifier;\n    } else if (relativeX > 1 - TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO) {\n      keys['ArrowRight'] = true;\n      touchState.rightTouchId = touch.identifier;\n    }\n  }\n}\n\nfunction handleTouchMove(event) {\n  if (!gameState.playing || gameState.isPaused) return;\n  event.preventDefault();\n  \n  const rect = cv.getBoundingClientRect();\n  \n  for (let touch of event.changedTouches) {\n    const touchData = touchState.touches[touch.identifier];\n    if (!touchData) continue;\n    \n    const x = touch.clientX - rect.left;\n    const relativeX = x / rect.width;\n    \n    // Update movement based on current position\n    if (touch.identifier === touchState.leftTouchId && relativeX >= TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO) {\n      keys['ArrowLeft'] = false;\n      touchState.leftTouchId = null;\n    } else if (touch.identifier === touchState.rightTouchId && relativeX <= 1 - TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO) {\n      keys['ArrowRight'] = false;\n      touchState.rightTouchId = null;\n    }\n    \n    // Check for new movement area\n    if (relativeX < TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO && touch.identifier !== touchState.leftTouchId) {\n      keys['ArrowLeft'] = true;\n      touchState.leftTouchId = touch.identifier;\n    } else if (relativeX > 1 - TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO && touch.identifier !== touchState.rightTouchId) {\n      keys['ArrowRight'] = true;\n      touchState.rightTouchId = touch.identifier;\n    }\n  }\n}\n\nfunction handleTouchEnd(event) {\n  if (!gameState.playing || gameState.isPaused) return;\n  \n  for (let touch of event.changedTouches) {\n    const touchData = touchState.touches[touch.identifier];\n    if (!touchData) continue;\n    \n    const deltaX = touch.clientX - touchData.startX;\n    const deltaY = touch.clientY - touchData.startY;\n    const deltaTime = now() - touchData.startTime;\n    \n    // Check for swipe up (jump)\n    if (deltaTime < SWIPE_TIME_THRESHOLD && \n        deltaY < -SWIPE_THRESHOLD && \n        Math.abs(deltaY) > Math.abs(deltaX) * 1.5) {\n      keys['Space'] = true;\n      setTimeout(() => keys['Space'] = false, 50);\n    }\n    \n    // Clear movement keys\n    if (touch.identifier === touchState.leftTouchId) {\n      keys['ArrowLeft'] = false;\n      touchState.leftTouchId = null;\n    }\n    if (touch.identifier === touchState.rightTouchId) {\n      keys['ArrowRight'] = false;\n      touchState.rightTouchId = null;\n    }\n    \n    delete touchState.touches[touch.identifier];\n  }\n}\n\n// Confetti effect\nfunction confetti(count = 150, enhanced = false) {\n  const colors = [\n    getCSSVar('--accent-neon-cyan'),\n    getCSSVar('--accent-neon-magenta'),\n    getCSSVar('--accent-neon-lime'),\n    getCSSVar('--accent-neon-orange'),\n    getCSSVar('--accent-neon-yellow'),\n    getCSSVar('--accent')\n  ];\n  \n  for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {\n    setTimeout(() => {\n      const div = document.createElement('div');\n      const size = enhanced ? rand(6, 12) : rand(4, 8);\n      \n      Object.assign(div.style, {\n        position: 'fixed',\n        left: '50%',\n        top: '40%',\n        width: size + 'px',\n        height: size + 'px',\n        background: colors[Math.floor(Math.random() * colors.length)],\n        borderRadius: enhanced ? '2px' : '50%',\n        transform: `translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(${rand(0, 360)}deg)`,\n        zIndex: 9999,\n        pointerEvents: 'none'\n      });\n      \n      if (enhanced) {\n        div.style.boxShadow = `0 0 ${size}px currentColor`;\n      }\n      \n      document.body.appendChild(div);\n      \n      let vx = rand(-8, 8);\n      let vy = rand(-12, -6);\n      let rotation = rand(-10, 10);\n      let life = 0;\n      const maxLife = rand(60, 100);\n      \n      function animate() {\n        life++;\n        vx *= 0.98;\n        vy += 0.4;\n        rotation *= 0.99;\n        \n        const x = parseFloat(div.style.left) + vx;\n        const y = parseFloat(div.style.top) + vy;\n        const currentRotation = parseFloat(div.style.transform.match(/rotate\\((.+)deg\\)/)[1]);\n        \n        div.style.left = x + '%';\n        div.style.top = y + '%';\n        div.style.transform = `translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(${currentRotation + rotation}deg)`;\n        div.style.opacity = Math.max(0, 1 - life / maxLife);\n        \n        if (life < maxLife) {\n          requestAnimationFrame(animate);\n        } else {\n          div.remove();\n        }\n      }\n      \n      requestAnimationFrame(animate);\n    }, i * (enhanced ? 8 : 5));\n  }\n}\n\n// Initialize accent-dependent styles\ndocument.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {\n  const accent = getCSSVar('--accent');\n  \n  // Update button styles\n  document.querySelectorAll('button').forEach(btn => {\n    btn.style.setProperty('--button-text-color', accent);\n    btn.style.setProperty('--button-bg-hover', accent);\n  });\n  \n  // Update wrapper\n  const wrap = document.querySelector('.wrap');\n  if (wrap) {\n    wrap.style.borderColor = accent;\n    wrap.style.boxShadow = `0 0 30px ${accent}`;\n  }\n  \n  // Update canvas\n  if (cv) {\n    cv.style.borderColor = accent;\n    cv.style.boxShadow = `0 0 20px ${accent}`;\n  }\n});\n\n// Handle visibility change\ndocument.addEventListener('visibilitychange', () => {\n  if (document.hidden && gameState.playing && !gameState.isPaused) {\n    togglePause();\n  }\n});\n\n// Prevent zoom on double tap\nlet lastTouchEnd = 0;\ndocument.addEventListener('touchend', (e) => {\n  const now = Date.now();\n  if (now - lastTouchEnd <= 300) {\n    e.preventDefault();\n  }\n  lastTouchEnd = now;\n}, false);\n</script>\n</body>\n</html>","source":"HTML"}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"kcaq912126","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"HTML","id":"fuf5u11017","nodes":[],"htmlData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":true,"height":{"custom":"68"},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"LEFT","width":{"custom":"750"}},"html":"<style>\n
