Determined to immerse herself in the kind of global work she hoped to one day lead, she convinced her parents to support a year-long volunteer trip to India. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"al0nt814","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"6bhey815","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"“I was going to spend a year doing volunteer work.” Katz said. “The plan was to spend the first six months in southern India working helping out in maternal and child health clinics and then spend the last six months volunteering for Mother Teresa.”","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"8qxoj817","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"midnf818","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"But that plan unraveled when Katz fell gravely ill. After just a few months, she was forced to cut her trip short and return to the U.S., where doctors struggled to diagnose her. For eight months, she remained sick while medical teams searched for answers. Ultimately, they discovered she had contracted a rare pathogen that had once been weaponized by the U.S. military in the 1950s as part of its former offensive biological weapons program. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"cyz6s820","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"v0oir821","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"This experience, harrowing and surreal, would change everything, she said. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"unoyq823","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"opo6x824","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"While enduring her illness, Katz began her Master’s in Public Health at Yale University, choosing the school not just for its academics, but for its access to top-tier doctors to treat her illness. She found herself in a strange dual reality.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"6knen826","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"m14rg827","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"“I was discovering the field of epidemiology… And I was also becoming really smart on my own disease,” Katz said. “If you have the intellectual capacity to do so, you have to become your own advocate.”","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"ci9vi829","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"33ps5830","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"In the process of becoming an expert in her own disease, Katz ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"stumbled","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(17, 85, 204)"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/16964579/","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" upon a body of literature about biological weapons and biodefense, topics that had not yet entered the mainstream of undergraduate study. Her experience gave her a uniquely visceral connection to the subject. With a background in policy, economics, and epidemiology, she saw a new convergence of disciplines: national security and global health.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"t5zku834","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"w5wbi835","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Though there were few formal paths to follow in this emerging field, Katz couldn’t shake the feeling that this was where she was meant to be, she said. She began attending niche meetings, often the only woman in the room, and usually the youngest by far, slowly carving out space in a field that hadn’t yet fully formed. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"e2o6n7075","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"DIVIDER","id":"5k8zr2440","nodes":[],"dividerData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":false,"height":{},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"CENTER","width":{}},"lineStyle":"SINGLE","width":"LARGE","alignment":"CENTER"}},{"style":{},"id":"8dz6a838","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Pioneering a New Field in the Wake of National Crises","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700},{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"headingData":{"level":2,"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"type":"HEADING"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"4jrwm840","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"ak57j841","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"By the time Katz decided to pursue a PhD in 2000, she had a clear idea of what she wanted to study: the intersection of disease and security. Most schools didn’t quite know what to make of her proposal, but Katz pushed forward, undeterred. Eventually, a former dean from her program at Yale, who had now moved to Princeton, encouraged her to pursue her graduate studies within their School of Public and International Affairs (formerly the Woodrow Wilson School). There, Katz had the opportunity to combine courses in Epidemiology and National Security, and would soon be writing about biological weapons as a public health threat — inadvertently submitting one of her exam papers on September 10, 2001.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"508a9843","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"rtvq0844","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"“The thing everyone had been humoring me about, well, it became a real thing after 9/11 and the Anthrax attacks,” Katz said.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"oh274846","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"This background set the stage for a meteoric rise for the field of biosecurity, a sphere that Katz’s background perfectly aligned with. Here she sought out internships within the intelligence community and simultaneously collected data for her dissertation. Through an historical analysis of biological agents used in warfare, Katz declassified almost 9,000 pages of documents to finish her thesis.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"ta989848","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"xxu7a849","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"From there, having earned her PhD, Dr. Katz began consulting for the U.S. Department of State. Between 2004 and 2019, she supported U.S. delegations to the Biological Weapons Convention (BWC) in Geneva, Switzerland, advising on global norms around the peaceful use of biological science and the prevention of biological weapons development. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"6amds420","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"IMAGE","id":"cl4my728","nodes":[{"type":"CAPTION","id":"myfq8753","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Palais des Nations in Geneva, Switzerland, home of the United Nations Office at Geneva","decorations":[]}}]}],"imageData":{"image":{"src":{"id":"11b1c4_966648bf45b348f0b3b5fe04a3895f99~mv2.jpeg"},"width":9434,"height":6289},"disableDownload":true,"altText":"The grand facade of the Palais des Nations, the United Nations building in Geneva, viewed from a walkway lined on both sides by long rows of international flags on tall flagpoles.","caption":"Palais des Nations in Geneva, Switzerland, home of the United Nations Office at Geneva","containerData":{"width":{"size":"SMALL"},"alignment":"CENTER","textWrap":true}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"knx2q851","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"53p9d852","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"In parallel, Katz worked closely with global partners, including the World Health Organization’s (WHO) Health Emergencies Programme, where she shared expertise on emergency preparedness and the International Health Regulations. At the policy level, Katz collaborated with ministries of health and foreign affairs in countries such as Uganda, India, and Jordan, helping to design and evaluate pandemic preparedness plans, infectious disease reporting systems, and public health emergency operations centers. Her advisory work has also extended to the Global Health Security Agenda (GHSA), where she has supported the design of the program..","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"6p6gf854","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"However, it wasn’t long before Katz found herself drawn back into academia. In 2005, a former mentor encouraged her to lecture in his course at the George Washington University (GWU) School of Medicine. Lecturing led to more interactions with the GWU faculty, and soon the School of Public Health — now the Milken Institute School of Public Health — soon offered Katz a faculty position. There, she continued her work at the intersection of epidemiology and national security, ultimately receiving a prestigious K Award from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to support her research.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"dak4b856","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"edsr0857","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Still consulting with the State Department, Katz eventually transitioned her research group to Georgetown University in 2016. She now leads their Center for Global Health Science and Security, where she has continued to shape the field of health security through policy research, education, and public engagement.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"sbmlb2813","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"DIVIDER","id":"e5bun2724","nodes":[],"dividerData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":false,"height":{},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"CENTER","width":{}},"lineStyle":"SINGLE","width":"LARGE","alignment":"CENTER"}},{"style":{},"id":"0z776860","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Applying Decades of Experience to the Front Lines of a Global Pandemic","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700},{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"headingData":{"level":2,"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"type":"HEADING"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"cbbf6862","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"7uk7z863","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"In early 2020, as the global threat of COVID-19 began to emerge, Katz’s years of experience positioned her at the forefront of the response. She was one of the first scientists in the United States to publicly call for the outbreak to be declared a public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC). On February 28, 2020, she published “","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The Novel Coronavirus Originating in Wuhan, China","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(17, 85, 204)"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2760500","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2760500","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Challenges for Global Health Governance","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(17, 85, 204)"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2760500","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"” as a warning. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"vw9m0869","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"fw50r870","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"“We are now faced with the very real prospect that COVID-19 may become a pandemic,” Katz wrote in the publication. “Health leaders and policymakers should begin to plan for a pandemic.”","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"m8e1k872","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"abl37873","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"While the WHO would not officially declare COVID-19 a pandemic until March 11, 2020,  Katz’s early call reflected the urgency that much of the public health community was beginning to feel. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"cvuc1875","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"w8ugl876","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Leading up to and following the 2020 election, Katz served on the Biden-Harris Transition COVID-19 team, helping shape public health strategies for the incoming administration. She also rejoined the State Department, serving under Secretary Antony Blinken as a senior advisor on pandemic response and global health security.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"35p2x878","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"3fo7u879","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"For Katz and others in the field, identifying public health as a national security challenge became a lot more apparent after the COVID-19 pandemic. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"pdrrw881","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"DIVIDER","id":"551y03118","nodes":[],"dividerData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":false,"height":{},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"CENTER","width":{}},"lineStyle":"SINGLE","width":"LARGE","alignment":"CENTER"}},{"style":{},"id":"vpwcj882","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"A Framework for Future Preparedness Through Interdisciplinary Collaboration","decorations":[{"type":"BOLD","fontWeightValue":700},{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"headingData":{"level":2,"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"type":"HEADING"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"6csvb884","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"k4wln885","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Katz has spent much of her career thinking about that question. For her, the answer is not rooted in a single discipline, tool, or institution. It is about collaboration.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"t7snp887","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"1av42888","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"“When you’re responding to an outbreak, you don't just need epidemiologists. You need virologists, clinicians, politicians, economists, logisticians, behavioral scientists,” she said.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"lqfws890","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"mnkwb891","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"In theory, that level of coordination sounds simple. In practice, it remains elusive. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"deh3v893","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"g8d2y894","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"“A challenge in academia is that it’s still organized in silos, but the problems we face are multidisciplinary,” Katz said.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"juaip896","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"a9yl4897","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"This obstacle was part of what motivated Katz to move her lab from GWU to Georgetown, where she hoped to foster a more multidisciplinary approach to research. However, interdisciplinarity amongst departments is not enough. Katz also believes Washington, D.C. holds a unique position in the field of health security.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"w57tw899","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"b57ce900","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"“The proximity to decision-makers is critical. You can walk down the street and have a coffee with someone at the HHS or State Department,” Katz said. “It’s not just about being near them — it’s about having a relationship where people know your work and trust your judgment.”","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"uwryh902","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"uo99c903","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"To help bridge these gaps, Katz and her team have ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"launched","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(17, 85, 204)"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://ampeid.org/","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" several tools and initiatives aimed at building stronger, data-driven responses to pandemics. This includes the","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":" ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}},{"type":"LINK","linkData":{"link":{"url":"https://ampeid.org/","target":"BLANK"}}},{"type":"UNDERLINE"}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"Analysis and Mapping of Policies for Emerging Infectious Diseases (AMPED) project that catalogues global health policies and how they may affect outbreak outcomes.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"f0k2i909","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"qebkr910","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"These tools reflect a core principle in Katz’s work: knowledge should be actionable. Whether writing early warnings, creating digital tools for decision-makers, or mentoring the next generation of public health leaders, her focus remains the same.","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"0llsv912","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"sl1gz913","nodes":[{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"The next pandemic is not a question of ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"if","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}},{"type":"ITALIC","italicData":true}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":", but ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":"when","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}},{"type":"ITALIC","italicData":true}]}},{"type":"TEXT","id":"","nodes":[],"textData":{"text":". The better the nation understands the systems that failed — and the people and partnerships that responded — the more prepared the country and the world will be to face the music. ","decorations":[{"type":"COLOR","colorData":{"background":"transparent","foreground":"rgb(0, 0, 0)"}}]}}],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"mfdof919","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"HTML","id":"4jqzt5536","nodes":[],"htmlData":{"containerData":{"textWrap":true,"height":{"custom":"552"},"spoiler":{},"alignment":"CENTER","width":{"custom":"940"}},"html":"<!DOCTYPE html>\n<html lang=\"en\">\n<head>\n<meta charset=\"UTF-8\">\n<meta name=\"viewport\" content=\"width=device-width,initial-scale=1.0,user-scalable=no\">\n<title>Biosecurity Dash: Katz's Insight</title> <style>\n:root {\n  /* Base Neon Theme */\n  --bg-main-canvas: #12121a; \n  --bg-wrap: #000000; \n  --text-color-on-dark: #e0e0e0; \n  --text-color-dark-for-button-hover: #12121a;\n\n  --accent-neon-cyan: #00ffff;\n  --accent-neon-magenta: #ff00ff;\n  --accent-neon-lime: #39ff14;\n  --accent-neon-orange: #ff8c00;\n  --accent-neon-yellow: #ffff00;\n  --accent-neon-electricblue: #7df9ff;\n  --accent: var(--accent-neon-lime); \n\n  --player-fill: var(--accent);\n  --player-glow: var(--accent);\n  --platform-fill: #2a2a3e;\n  --platform-highlight: #4a4a6e;\n  --platform-outline: var(--accent-neon-cyan);\n  --block-active-fill: var(--accent-neon-orange);\n  --block-active-glow: var(--accent-neon-orange);\n  --block-key-color: var(--accent-neon-yellow);\n  --block-used-fill: #333;\n  --block-correct-fill: var(--accent-neon-lime);\n  --coin-fill: var(--accent-neon-yellow);\n  --coin-glow: var(--accent-neon-yellow);\n  --enemy-mite-fill: var(--accent-neon-magenta);\n  --enemy-mite-glow: var(--accent-neon-magenta);\n  --enemy-golem-fill: var(--accent-neon-orange);\n  --enemy-golem-glow: var(--accent-neon-orange);\n  --goal-fill: var(--accent-neon-electricblue);\n  --goal-glow: var(--accent-neon-electricblue);\n  --goal-portal-accent: #fff;\n  --goal-locked-fill: #444;\n  --projectile-fill: #ffffff;\n  --projectile-glow: #ffffff;\n  --hud-text-color: var(--text-color-on-dark); \n  --button-text-color: var(--accent); \n  --button-bg-hover: var(--accent);\n  --button-text-hover: var(--text-color-dark-for-button-hover); \n  --font: \"Courier New\", monospace;\n  --glow-intensity: 8px;\n}\n\n*{box-sizing:border-box;}\nbody{\n  margin:0;font-family:var(--font); background: transparent; color: var(--text-color-on-dark); \n  display:flex;justify-content:center;align-items:flex-start;min-height:100vh;padding-top:0.5em; \n  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent; \n}\n.wrap{\n  width:95%; max-width:720px; margin:0.5em auto;padding:15px; \n  background: var(--bg-wrap); border-radius:14px;box-shadow:0 0 25px var(--accent);text-align:center; \n  border: 1px solid var(--accent); position: relative;\n}\n#gameInstruction {\n  font-size: 0.75em; \n  color: var(--text-color-on-dark);\n  margin-top: 0;\n  margin-bottom: 0.3em; \n  font-weight: normal;\n  text-shadow: none;\n}\nh2{ margin:0 0 .5em;font-size:1.3em; color: var(--text-color-on-dark); text-shadow:0 0 6px var(--accent), 0 0 10px var(--accent); }\ncanvas{\n  border: 2px solid var(--accent); border-radius: 6px; display: block; margin: 0 auto;\n  width: 100%; height: auto; aspect-ratio: 720 / 300;\n  image-rendering: -moz-crisp-edges;image-rendering: -webkit-crisp-edges;image-rendering: pixelated;image-rendering: crisp-edges;\n  box-shadow: 0 0 10px var(--accent); touch-action: none; \n}\n#hud{ font-size:.8em;margin:.5em 0; color: var(--hud-text-color); text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.5); }\nbutton { \n  padding:10px 18px;font-size:0.85em;margin:4px; border:2px solid var(--button-text-color);\n  background:transparent;color:var(--button-text-color); cursor:pointer;transition:.2s; \n  text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px; font-weight: bold;box-shadow: 0 0 6px var(--button-text-color); \n}\nbutton:hover{ \n  background:var(--button-bg-hover);color:var(--button-text-hover); \n  box-shadow: 0 0 12px var(--button-bg-hover), 0 0 18px var(--button-bg-hover); \n  transform: translateY(-2px); \n}\nbutton:disabled {\n    opacity: 0.5;\n    cursor: not-allowed;\n}\n#pauseBtn { \n    display: none;\n}\n#gamePausedOverlay {\n    position: absolute;\n    top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%;\n    background: rgba(0,0,0,0.7);\n    color: white;\n    font-size: 2em;\n    display: flex;\n    align-items: center;\n    justify-content: center;\n    z-index: 5000; \n    border-radius: 6px; \n    pointer-events: none; \n}\n\n#msg{ font-size:1.1em;height:1.4em;margin-top:.4em; font-weight:bold; color: var(--text-color-on-dark); text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px var(--accent); }\n\n#questionModal { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; right: 0; bottom: 0; background: rgba(10, 10, 20, 0.92); display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; z-index: 10000;opacity: 0; pointer-events: none; transition: opacity 0.3s ease-in-out;border-radius: 12px; }\n#questionModal.visible { opacity: 1; pointer-events: auto; }\n#qBox { background: var(--bg-main-canvas);padding: 15px 20px;border-radius: 10px; border: 2px solid var(--accent);box-shadow: 0 0 15px var(--accent); width: 90%; max-width: 450px;text-align: center;color: var(--text-color-on-dark); }\n#qText { font-size: 1em; margin-bottom: 15px; line-height: 1.3; } \n#qOptionsContainer button { display: block; width: 100%; margin: 8px 0; padding: 12px; font-size: 0.9em; border: 2px solid var(--accent); background: transparent; color: var(--accent); border-radius: 5px; cursor: pointer; transition: background-color 0.2s, color 0.2s, box-shadow 0.2s; }\n#qOptionsContainer button:hover:not(:disabled) { background: var(--accent); color: var(--button-text-hover); box-shadow: 0 0 10px var(--accent); }\n#qOptionsContainer button:disabled { opacity: 0.7; cursor: default; }\n#qFeedback { min-height: 1.4em; margin-top: 10px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 0.9em; line-height: 1.3; } \n\n@media (max-width: 399px) { \n  .wrap { display: none !important; }\n}\n@media (min-width: 400px) and (max-width: 600px) { \n    .wrap { width: 95%; padding: 10px; } \n    #gameInstruction { font-size: 0.7em; margin-bottom: 0.2em; } \n    h2 { font-size: 1.1em; margin-bottom: 0.3em;}\n    #hud { font-size: 0.7em; margin: 0.3em 0; }\n    button { padding: 8px 12px; font-size: 0.75em; margin: 3px;} \n    #msg { font-size: 0.9em; }\n    #qBox { padding: 10px 15px; width: 95%;}\n    #qText { font-size: 0.9em; margin-bottom: 10px; }\n    #qOptionsContainer button { padding: 10px; font-size: 0.85em; margin: 6px 0; }\n    #qFeedback { font-size: 0.85em; }\n}\n</style>\n</head>\n<body>\n<div class=\"wrap\">\n  <p id=\"gameInstruction\">Play to test your knowledge</p> \n  <h2>🦠 Biosecurity Dash: Katz's Insight</h2> <div id=\"gameCanvasContainer\" style=\"position: relative;\"> <canvas id=\"cv\" width=\"720\" height=\"300\"></canvas>\n    <div id=\"gamePausedOverlay\" style=\"display: none;\">PAUSED</div>\n  </div>\n  <div id=\"hud\">Score 0 | Lives 3 | Time 120</div>\n  <button id=\"btn\" type=\"button\">Start</button>\n  <button id=\"pauseBtn\" type=\"button\">Pause</button> <div id=\"msg\"></div>\n  <div id=\"questionModal\"><div id=\"qBox\"><p id=\"qText\"></p><div id=\"qOptionsContainer\"></div><p id=\"qFeedback\"></p></div></div>\n</div>\n\n<script>\n/* ---------- ACCENT COLOR & DOM ELEMENTS ---------- */\nconst cv = document.getElementById('cv'), ctx = cv.getContext('2d');\nconst W = cv.width, H = cv.height; \nconst msgEl = document.getElementById('msg'), btnEl = document.getElementById('btn'), hudEl = document.getElementById('hud');\nconst pauseBtnEl = document.getElementById('pauseBtn');\nconst gamePausedOverlayEl = document.getElementById('gamePausedOverlay');\nconst questionModalEl = document.getElementById('questionModal');\nconst qTextEl = document.getElementById('qText');\nconst qOptionsContainerEl = document.getElementById('qOptionsContainer');\nconst qFeedbackEl = document.getElementById('qFeedback');\n\n(()=>{ /* Accent Initializer */\n  const accents = ['--accent-neon-cyan', '--accent-neon-magenta', '--accent-neon-lime', '--accent-neon-orange', '--accent-neon-yellow', '--accent-neon-electricblue'];\n  const chosenAccentName = accents[Math.floor(Math.random()*accents.length)];\n  const chosenAccentValue = getComputedStyle(document.documentElement).getPropertyValue(chosenAccentName).trim();\n  document.documentElement.style.setProperty('--accent', chosenAccentValue);\n  document.documentElement.style.setProperty('--player-fill', chosenAccentValue);\n  document.documentElement.style.setProperty('--player-glow', chosenAccentValue);\n})();\n\n\n/* ---------- GAME CONSTANTS ---------- */\nconst PLAYER_W = 20, PLAYER_H = 20;\nconst PLAYER_SPEED = 3.5; const PLAYER_JUMP_POWER = 10; const GRAVITY = 0.4; const TERMINAL_VELOCITY = 10;\nconst GROUND_Y = H - 60; const BLOCK_W = 24, BLOCK_H = 24; const COIN_SIZE = 12; const KEY_ICON_SIZE_FACTOR = 0.65;\nconst NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS = 7; const PLATFORM_MIN_W = 80; const PLATFORM_MAX_W = 150; const PLATFORM_H = 15;\nconst X_GAP_MIN = 40; const X_GAP_MAX = 100; \nconst Y_CHANGE_MAX = 45; \nconst MIN_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_TOP = H * 0.30; \nconst MAX_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_GROUND = GROUND_Y - PLATFORM_H - BLOCK_H - PLAYER_H - 15; \nconst INITIAL_PLATFORM_X_START = 120;\nconst COIN_SPIN_SPEED = 0.07;\n\n/* ---------- GAME STATE ---------- */\nlet playing=false,isPaused=false,player,platforms,enemies,coins,blocks,goal,\n    camX,score,lives,timeLeft,timerInt,spawnFire=false,doubleJump=false,\n    keys={}, projectiles=[], bgStars=[], currentBlockInteracting = null;\n\n/* ---------- TOUCH CONTROLS STATE ---------- */\nlet touchStartData = {}; \nlet leftTouchId = null, rightTouchId = null;\n// ongoingTouches will be an implicit global \nconst SWIPE_THRESHOLD = 30; \nconst SWIPE_TIME_THRESHOLD = 400; \nconst TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO = 0.4; \n\n/* ---------- EVENT LISTENERS ---------- */\ndocument.addEventListener('keydown',e=>{\n    keys[e.code]=true;\n    if(e.code==='Space'||e.code.startsWith('Arrow'))e.preventDefault();\n    if(e.code === 'KeyP' && playing) { \n        togglePause();\n    }\n});\ndocument.addEventListener('keyup',e=>keys[e.code]=false);\nbtnEl.onclick=startGame;\npauseBtnEl.onclick = togglePause;\n\n\n/* ---------- HELPERS ---------- */\nfunction getCSSVar(varName) { return getComputedStyle(document.documentElement).getPropertyValue(varName).trim(); }\nconst rand = (a, b) => Math.random() * (b - a) + a;\nconst randInt = (a, b) => Math.floor(rand(a, b + 1));\nfunction collide(a,b){return a.x<b.x+b.w && a.x+a.w>b.x && a.y<b.y+b.h && a.y+a.h>b.y}\n\n/* ---------- BACKGROUND ---------- */\nfunction initBackgroundStars(numStars = 100) { bgStars = []; for (let i = 0; i < numStars; i++) { bgStars.push({ x: Math.random() * W, y: Math.random() * H, radius: rand(0.5, 1.5), alpha: rand(0.3, 0.8), parallax: rand(0.1, 0.4) }); } }\nfunction drawBackground() { \n    ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--bg-main-canvas'); ctx.fillRect(0,0,W,H); \n    ctx.fillStyle = '#fff'; \n    bgStars.forEach(star => { const xPos = (star.x - camX * star.parallax + W*2) % W; ctx.beginPath(); ctx.arc(xPos, star.y, star.radius, 0, Math.PI * 2); ctx.globalAlpha = star.alpha; ctx.fill(); }); \n    ctx.globalAlpha = 1.0; \n    ctx.strokeStyle = \"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05)\"; ctx.lineWidth = 0.5; \n    for (let i = 0; i < H; i += 30) { ctx.beginPath(); ctx.moveTo(0, i); ctx.lineTo(W, i); ctx.stroke(); } \n    const firstVisibleWorldX = Math.floor(camX / 30) * 30;\n    const lastVisibleWorldX = Math.ceil((camX + W) / 30) * 30;\n    for (let worldX = firstVisibleWorldX; worldX <= lastVisibleWorldX; worldX += 30) {\n        const screenX = worldX - camX;\n        ctx.beginPath(); ctx.moveTo(screenX, 0); ctx.lineTo(screenX, H); ctx.stroke();\n    }\n    ctx.lineWidth = 1; \n}\n\n/* ---------- LEVEL DATA (RANDOMIZED - Refined for Playability) ---------- */\nfunction buildLevel(){\n  player={x:50,y:GROUND_Y-PLAYER_H,w:PLAYER_W,h:PLAYER_H,vx:0,vy:0,onGround:false,jumps:0, angle:0};\n  \n  platforms = []; coins = []; enemies = []; blocks = [];\n\n  const estimatedGroundWidth = INITIAL_PLATFORM_X_START + (NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS + 3) * (PLATFORM_MAX_W + X_GAP_MAX); \n  platforms.push({x: -50, y:GROUND_Y, w: estimatedGroundWidth + 100, h:60, type:'ground'});\n\n  let currentX = INITIAL_PLATFORM_X_START;\n  let previousPlatformY = GROUND_Y - rand(PLAYER_H + PLATFORM_H + 5, PLAYER_JUMP_POWER * PLAYER_JUMP_POWER / (2 * GRAVITY) * 0.75); \n  previousPlatformY = Math.min(previousPlatformY, MAX_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_GROUND); \n\n  const blockPlacementInterval = Math.max(1, Math.floor(NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS / Q.length));\n  let nextBlockPlatformIndex = randInt(0,1); \n  let qBlockIndex = 0;\n\n  for (let i = 0; i < NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS; i++) {\n    const pWidth = rand(PLATFORM_MIN_W, PLATFORM_MAX_W);\n    let pY = previousPlatformY + rand(-Y_CHANGE_MAX, Y_CHANGE_MAX * 0.6); \n    pY = Math.max(MIN_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_TOP, Math.min(pY, MAX_PLATFORM_Y_ABS_FROM_GROUND)); \n\n    platforms.push({ x: currentX, y: pY, w: pWidth, h: PLATFORM_H });\n    const currentPlatform = platforms[platforms.length-1];\n\n    if (i === nextBlockPlatformIndex && qBlockIndex < Q.length) {\n        blocks.push({ x: currentPlatform.x + currentPlatform.w / 2 - BLOCK_W / 2, y: currentPlatform.y - BLOCK_H, w: BLOCK_W, h: BLOCK_H, state: '?', qID: qBlockIndex });\n        qBlockIndex++;\n        nextBlockPlatformIndex += blockPlacementInterval + randInt(0,1); \n         if (nextBlockPlatformIndex >= NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS && qBlockIndex < Q.length) {\n             if (i < NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS -1) nextBlockPlatformIndex = i + 1; \n             else nextBlockPlatformIndex = NUM_MAIN_PLATFORMS -1; \n         }\n    } \n    else if (Math.random() < 0.3 && blocks.every(b => Math.abs( (b.x + b.w/2) - (currentPlatform.x + currentPlatform.w/2) ) > PLATFORM_MIN_W/2 )) { \n        const enemyType = Math.random() < 0.6 ? 'mite' : 'golem';\n        const enemyW = (enemyType === 'mite' ? 20 : 24); const enemyH = (enemyType === 'mite' ? 20 : 24);\n        enemies.push({ x: currentPlatform.x + rand(0, currentPlatform.w - enemyW), y: currentPlatform.y - enemyH, w: enemyW, h: enemyH, dir: Math.random() < 0.5 ? 1 : -1, type: enemyType, patrolMinX: currentPlatform.x, patrolMaxX: currentPlatform.x + currentPlatform.w - enemyW });\n    }\n\n    for (let j = 0; j < randInt(1,2); j++) { \n        coins.push({ \n            x: currentPlatform.x + rand(COIN_SIZE, currentPlatform.w - COIN_SIZE*2), \n            y: currentPlatform.y - PLATFORM_H - rand(COIN_SIZE + 10, COIN_SIZE + 40), \n            w: COIN_SIZE, h: COIN_SIZE, collected: false, \n            angle: rand(0, Math.PI*2), \n            spinSpeed: COIN_SPIN_SPEED \n        }); \n    }\n    \n    previousPlatformY = pY;\n    currentX += pWidth + rand(X_GAP_MIN, X_GAP_MAX);\n  }\n\n  const lastMainPlatform = platforms[platforms.length-1];\n  const goalPlatformX = lastMainPlatform.x + lastMainPlatform.w + rand(X_GAP_MIN + 20, X_GAP_MAX + 40);\n  const goalPlatformY = GROUND_Y - rand(60, 100); \n  platforms.push({ x: goalPlatformX, y: goalPlatformY, w: 100, h: PLATFORM_H, type:'goal_platform'});\n  \n  goal = { x: goalPlatformX + 50 - 20, y: goalPlatformY - 60, w: 40, h: 60, isLocked: true };\n  \n  if (platforms[0].w < goal.x + goal.w + W/2) { \n      platforms[0].w = goal.x + goal.w + W/2;\n  }\n\n  camX=0;score=0;lives=3;timeLeft=120;spawnFire=false;doubleJump=false;projectiles=[];\n  initBackgroundStars(); updateGoalLockState();\n}\n/* ---------- QUESTIONS DATA (Professor Michael Keidar Article) ---------- */\nconst Q = [\n  {\n    qID: 0,\n    q: \"What personal event first redirected Dr. Katz's career path from global health economics toward national security and biodefense?\",\n    options: [\n      { text: \"The events of 9/11 and the subsequent Anthrax attacks.\", correct: false },\n      { text: \"A mentorship opportunity at the U.S. Department of State.\", correct: false },\n      { text: \"Contracting a rare pathogen that was once weaponized by the U.S. military.\", correct: true }\n    ],\n    feedbackCorrect: \"Correct! Her harrowing personal experience with a weaponized pathogen gave her a unique, visceral connection to the field of biosecurity.\",\n    feedbackIncorrect: \"Not quite. While major events shaped her field, the article states it was her own harrowing illness that first changed her career focus.\",\n    power: \"double\"\n  },\n  {\n    qID: 1,\n    q: \"What was the uniquely timely subject of the academic paper Dr. Katz submitted on September 10, 2001?\",\n    options: [\n      { text: \"The impact of access to clean water.\", correct: false },\n      { text: \"Biological Weapons as a Public Health issue.\", correct: true },\n      { text: \"The history of the World Health Organization.\", correct: false }\n    ],\n    feedbackCorrect: \"That's right! The article highlights the incredible coincidence of her submitting a paper on this niche topic the day before the 9/11 attacks.\",\n    feedbackIncorrect: \"Incorrect. The article notes the prescient topic of her paper was 'Biological Weapons as a Public Health issue,' a subject that became highly relevant overnight.\",\n    power: \"fire\"\n  },\n  {\n    qID: 2,\n    q: \"In early 2020, Dr. Katz was one of the first scientists to publicly call for what specific action in response to COVID-19?\",\n    options: [\n      { text: \"For the outbreak to be declared a public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC).\", correct: true },\n      { text: \"For the immediate closure of all international borders.\", correct: false },\n      { text: \"For the development of a messenger RNA (mRNA) vaccine.\", correct: false }\n    ],\n    feedbackCorrect: \"Correct! Her publication in February 2020 urged for a PHEIC declaration, reflecting the urgency she felt before it was officially declared a pandemic.\",\n    feedbackIncorrect: \"That's not it. The article highlights her early call for the WHO to declare the outbreak a 'public health emergency of international concern' (PHEIC).\",\n    power: \"double\" \n  },\n  {\n    qID: 3,\n    q: \"What does Dr. Katz believe is the most critical element for successfully responding to an outbreak?\",\n    options: [\n      { text: \"Having the world's most advanced virology labs.\", correct: false },\n      { text: \"Collaboration across many different disciplines, from scientists to politicians.\", correct: true },\n      { text: \"A large stockpile of personal protective equipment (PPE).\", correct: false }\n    ],\n    feedbackCorrect: \"Exactly! She emphasizes that responding to an outbreak requires a multidisciplinary team including epidemiologists, politicians, logisticians, and more.\",\n    feedbackIncorrect: \"Not quite. While those are important tools, Dr. Katz's core principle is that success comes from collaboration across many different fields.\",\n    power: \"both\"\n  }\n];\n\n/* ---------- DRAWING & GEOMETRY ---------- */\nfunction drawGeoRect(o, cFill, cStroke, glowColor, isPlayer = false) { const x = o.x - camX; const y = o.y; if (glowColor) { ctx.shadowColor = glowColor; ctx.shadowBlur = parseInt(getCSSVar('--glow-intensity')); } if (isPlayer && !player.onGround) { ctx.save(); ctx.translate(x + o.w / 2, y + o.h / 2); ctx.rotate(player.angle); ctx.fillStyle = cFill; ctx.fillRect(-o.w / 2, -o.h / 2, o.w, o.h); if (cStroke) { ctx.strokeStyle = cStroke; ctx.lineWidth = 2; ctx.strokeRect(-o.w / 2, -o.h / 2, o.w, o.h); } ctx.restore(); } else { ctx.fillStyle = cFill; ctx.fillRect(x, y, o.w, o.h); if (cStroke) { ctx.strokeStyle = cStroke; ctx.lineWidth = 2; ctx.strokeRect(x, y, o.w, o.h); } } if (glowColor) { ctx.shadowBlur = 0; } }\nfunction drawKeyIcon(blockCenterX, blockCenterY, keySize, keyColor) { const headRadius = keySize * 0.30; const stemWidth = keySize * 0.15; const stemLength = keySize * 0.65; const toothHeight = keySize * 0.12; const toothWidth = keySize * 0.20; ctx.fillStyle = keyColor; ctx.shadowBlur = 0; const headCenterY = blockCenterY - keySize * 0.15; ctx.beginPath(); ctx.arc(blockCenterX, headCenterY - stemLength * 0.35, headRadius, 0, Math.PI * 2); ctx.fill(); const stemTopY = headCenterY - stemLength * 0.35 + headRadius * 0.5; ctx.fillRect(blockCenterX - stemWidth / 2, stemTopY, stemWidth, stemLength); const teethBaseY = stemTopY + stemLength - toothHeight * 1.5; ctx.fillRect(blockCenterX + stemWidth / 2, teethBaseY - toothHeight * 0.8, toothWidth, toothHeight); ctx.fillRect(blockCenterX + stemWidth / 2, teethBaseY + toothHeight * 0.2, toothWidth, toothHeight); }\n\n/* ---------- GAME LOOP & UPDATE FUNCTIONS ---------- */\nfunction loop(){ \n    if(!playing || isPaused) { \n        if (isPaused && playing) { \n             draw(); \n             gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'flex';\n        }\n        return; \n    }\n    requestAnimationFrame(loop); \n    update(); \n    draw(); \n}\nfunction updateGoalLockState() { const allAnsweredCorrectly = blocks.every(b => b.state === 'used_correctly'); goal.isLocked = !allAnsweredCorrectly; }\n\nfunction update(){ \n  if(!playing || isPaused) return; \n\n  player.vx = 0; if (keys['ArrowRight']) player.vx = PLAYER_SPEED; if (keys['ArrowLeft']) player.vx = -PLAYER_SPEED;\n  \n  let minPlayerX = (platforms[0]) ? platforms[0].x : 0; \n  if (player.x <= minPlayerX && player.vx < 0) { player.x = minPlayerX; player.vx = 0; }\n  if (platforms.length > 0 && platforms[0] && player.x + player.w >= platforms[0].x + platforms[0].w && player.vx > 0) { player.vx = 0; player.x =player.x = platforms[0].x + platforms[0].w - player.w; }\n\n  if(keys['Space'] && (player.onGround || (doubleJump && player.jumps<2))){ player.vy=-PLAYER_JUMP_POWER;player.onGround=false;player.jumps++; keys['Space'] = false; }\n  player.vy+=GRAVITY; if(player.vy>TERMINAL_VELOCITY)player.vy=TERMINAL_VELOCITY;\n  player.x+=player.vx; player.y+=player.vy;\n  if (!player.onGround) { player.angle += player.vx * 0.05; } else { player.angle = 0; }\n  player.onGround=false;\n  platforms.forEach(p=>{ if(collide(player,p)){ if(player.vy >= 0 && (player.y + player.h - player.vy) <= p.y + 1) { player.y=p.y-player.h;player.vy=0;player.onGround=true;player.jumps=0;player.angle=0; } else if (player.y + player.h > p.y + Math.abs(player.vy * 0.5) && player.y < p.y + p.h - Math.abs(player.vy * 0.5) ) { if (player.vx > 0 && player.x + player.w - player.vx <= p.x +1) { player.x = p.x - player.w; player.vx = 0; } else if (player.vx < 0 && player.x - player.vx >= p.x + p.w -1) { player.x = p.x + p.w; player.vx = 0; } } else if (player.vy < 0 && player.y - player.vy >= p.y + p.h -1) { player.y = p.y + p.h; player.vy = 1; } } });\n  if(player.y > H + player.h * 2){loseLife();}\n  blocks.forEach(b => { if (collide(player, b)) { const pMidX = player.x + player.w / 2; const pMidY = player.y + player.h / 2; const bMidX = b.x + b.w / 2; const bMidY = b.y + b.h / 2; const dx = pMidX - bMidX; const dy = pMidY - bMidY; const combinedHalfWidths = player.w / 2 + b.w / 2; const combinedHalfHeights = player.h / 2 + b.h / 2; const overlapX = combinedHalfWidths - Math.abs(dx); const overlapY = combinedHalfHeights - Math.abs(dy); if (overlapX > 0 && overlapY > 0) { if (overlapX < overlapY) { if (dx > 0) { player.x = b.x + b.w; } else { player.x = b.x - player.w; } player.vx = 0; } else { if (dy > 0) { player.y = b.y + b.h; if (player.vy < 0) player.vy = 0; } else { player.y = b.y - player.h; if (player.vy > 0) player.vy = 0; player.onGround = true; player.jumps = 0; player.angle = 0;} } } if (b.state === '?' && playing && !isPaused) { b.state = 'asking'; currentBlockInteracting = b; player.vx = 0; const questionData = Q.find(ques => ques.qID === b.qID); if(questionData) showQuestionModal(questionData); else console.error(\"Question not found for block qID:\", b.qID); } } });\n  enemies.forEach(e=>{ if(e.dead) return; e.x += e.dir * (e.type === 'mite' ? 1.2 : 0.7); if (e.x < e.patrolMinX || e.x + e.w > e.patrolMaxX) { e.dir *= -1; e.x = Math.max(e.patrolMinX, Math.min(e.x, e.patrolMaxX - e.w)); } if(collide(player,e)){ if(player.vy > 0 && (player.y + player.h - player.vy) <= e.y + 1 ){ player.vy=-5; score+=5; e.dead=true; } else if (!e.dead) { loseLife(); } } });\n  if(spawnFire && keys['KeyF'] && projectiles.length < 3 && (!projectiles.lastFireTime || Date.now() - projectiles.lastFireTime > 300)){ const pSize = 10; const dir = (player.angle === 0 && player.vx === 0) ? (keys['ArrowRight'] ? 1 : (keys['ArrowLeft'] ? -1 : 1)) : (player.vx >= 0 ? 1 : -1); const ball={x:player.x + (dir > 0 ? player.w : -pSize) ,y:player.y+player.h/2 - pSize/2 ,vx: 6 * dir,vy:0,w:pSize,h:pSize}; projectiles.push(ball); projectiles.lastFireTime = Date.now(); }\n  projectiles.forEach((p)=>{ p.x+=p.vx; enemies.forEach(e=>{if(!e.dead && collide(p,e)){e.dead=true;p.hit=true;score+=5;}}); if(p.x < camX - p.w || p.x > camX + W + p.w) p.hit = true; });\n  projectiles=projectiles.filter(p=>!p.hit);\n  coins.forEach(c=>{ if(!c.collected) { c.angle += c.spinSpeed; if(collide(player,{x:c.x,y:c.y,w:c.w,h:c.h})){ c.collected=true;score+=10; } } });\n  updateGoalLockState(); if(!goal.isLocked && collide(player,goal))win();\n  let targetCamX = player.x - W/3; const minCamX = (platforms[0] && platforms[0].x < 0) ? platforms[0].x : 0; \n  const maxCamX = (platforms[0]) ? (platforms[0].x + platforms[0].w - W) : 0;\n  camX = Math.max(minCamX, Math.min(targetCamX, maxCamX));\n}\n\nfunction draw(){ \n  drawBackground();\n  platforms.forEach(p=> { drawGeoRect(p, getCSSVar('--platform-fill'), getCSSVar('--platform-outline'), null); ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--platform-highlight'); ctx.globalAlpha = 0.7; ctx.fillRect(p.x - camX, p.y, p.w, 3); ctx.globalAlpha = 1.0; });\n  coins.forEach(c=>{ if(!c.collected){ const x = c.x-camX + c.w/2; const y = c.y + c.h/2; ctx.save(); ctx.translate(x,y); ctx.rotate(c.angle); drawGeoRect({x: -c.w/2 + camX, y: -c.h/2, w:c.w, h:c.h}, getCSSVar('--coin-fill'), null, getCSSVar('--coin-glow')); ctx.restore(); } });\n  blocks.forEach(b=>{ let blockFill = getCSSVar('--block-used-fill'); let blockGlow = null; if (b.state === '?' || b.state === 'asking') { blockFill = getCSSVar('--block-active-fill'); blockGlow = getCSSVar('--block-active-glow'); } else if (b.state === 'used_correctly') { blockFill = getCSSVar('--block-correct-fill'); blockGlow = getCSSVar('--block-correct-fill'); } drawGeoRect(b, blockFill, null, blockGlow); if(b.state === '?' || b.state === 'asking'){ drawKeyIcon(b.x-camX+b.w/2, b.y+b.h/2, Math.min(b.w, b.h) * KEY_ICON_SIZE_FACTOR, getCSSVar('--block-key-color')); } });\n  enemies.forEach(e=>{ if(!e.dead){ const x = e.x-camX; const y = e.y; ctx.save(); ctx.shadowBlur = parseInt(getCSSVar('--glow-intensity')); if(e.type==='mite'){ ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--enemy-mite-fill'); ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--enemy-mite-glow'); ctx.beginPath(); ctx.moveTo(x + e.w/2, y); ctx.lineTo(x + e.w, y + e.h); ctx.lineTo(x, y + e.h); ctx.closePath(); ctx.fill(); } else { drawGeoRect(e, getCSSVar('--enemy-golem-fill'), getCSSVar('--enemy-golem-outline'), getCSSVar('--enemy-golem-glow')); } ctx.shadowBlur = 0; ctx.restore(); } });\n  projectiles.forEach(p=>{ drawGeoRect(p, getCSSVar('--projectile-fill'), null, getCSSVar('--projectile-glow')); });\n  drawGeoRect(player, getCSSVar('--player-fill'), null, getCSSVar('--player-glow'), true);\n  ctx.save(); const goalX = goal.x - camX; const goalY = goal.y; const pulse = Math.abs(Math.sin(Date.now()*0.002)) * 5; if (goal.isLocked) { ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--goal-locked-fill'); ctx.strokeStyle = '#222'; ctx.lineWidth = 2; ctx.fillRect(goalX, goalY, goal.w, goal.h); ctx.strokeRect(goalX, goalY, goal.w, goal.h); ctx.fillStyle = '#fff'; ctx.font = `bold ${goal.h*0.4}px ${getCSSVar('--font')}`; ctx.textAlign = 'center'; ctx.fillText('🔑', goalX + goal.w/2, goalY + goal.h/1.8); ctx.textAlign = 'left'; } else { ctx.shadowColor = getCSSVar('--goal-glow'); ctx.shadowBlur = parseInt(getCSSVar('--glow-intensity')) + pulse; ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--goal-fill'); ctx.fillRect(goalX, goalY, goal.w, goal.h); ctx.fillStyle = getCSSVar('--goal-portal-accent'); ctx.globalAlpha = 0.7 + Math.abs(Math.sin(Date.now()*0.003)) * 0.3; ctx.fillRect(goalX + goal.w*0.2, goalY + goal.h*0.2, goal.w*0.6, goal.h*0.6); ctx.globalAlpha = 1.0; } ctx.shadowBlur = 0; ctx.restore();\n}\n\n/* ---------- QUESTION MODAL LOGIC ---------- */\nfunction showQuestionModal(questionData) { \n    isPaused = true; \n    playing = false; \n    qTextEl.textContent = questionData.q; \n    qOptionsContainerEl.innerHTML = ''; qFeedbackEl.textContent = ''; qFeedbackEl.className = ''; \n    questionData.options.forEach(opt => { const button = document.createElement('button'); button.type = \"button\"; button.textContent = opt.text; button.onclick = () => handleAnswerSelection(opt, questionData); qOptionsContainerEl.appendChild(button); }); \n    questionModalEl.classList.add('visible'); \n}\nfunction handleAnswerSelection(selectedOption, questionData) { \n    Array.from(qOptionsContainerEl.children).forEach(btn => btn.disabled = true); \n    if (selectedOption.correct) { \n        qFeedbackEl.textContent = questionData.feedbackCorrect; qFeedbackEl.className = 'correct'; score += 25; \n        if (currentBlockInteracting) currentBlockInteracting.state = 'used_correctly'; \n        if (questionData.power === 'double') doubleJump = true; \n        if (questionData.power === 'fire') spawnFire = true; \n        if (questionData.power === 'both') { doubleJump = true; spawnFire = true; } \n    } else { \n        qFeedbackEl.textContent = questionData.feedbackIncorrect; qFeedbackEl.className = 'incorrect'; \n        if (currentBlockInteracting) currentBlockInteracting.state = '?'; \n        loseLife(); \n    } \n    updateHUD(); updateGoalLockState(); \n    setTimeout(() => { \n        questionModalEl.classList.remove('visible'); \n        currentBlockInteracting = null; \n        playing = true; \n        isPaused = false; \n        if (document.hasFocus() && lives > 0 && timeLeft > 0) { requestAnimationFrame(loop); } \n    }, 2500); \n}\n\n/* ---------- Game State Functions ---------- */\nfunction togglePause() {\n    if (!playing && !isPaused) return; \n\n    isPaused = !isPaused;\n    if (isPaused) {\n        pauseBtnEl.textContent = \"Resume\";\n        gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'flex';\n    } else {\n        pauseBtnEl.textContent = \"Pause\";\n        gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'none';\n        if (playing) { \n             requestAnimationFrame(loop);\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfunction loseLife(){ lives--; updateHUD(); if(lives<=0){gameOver();return;} player.x=Math.max(50, player.x - W/4); player.y=GROUND_Y-player.h - 70; player.vx=0;player.vy=-4; player.angle = 0; }\nfunction updateHUD(){hudEl.textContent=`Score: ${score} | Lives: ${lives} | Time: ${timeLeft}`;}\nfunction win(){ playing=false; isPaused = false; pauseBtnEl.style.display = 'none'; gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'none'; msgEl.textContent=\"🎉 LEVEL COMPLETE! 🎉\"; confetti(150, true); btnEl.style.display='inline-block';btnEl.textContent='Play Again'; clearInterval(timerInt); }\nfunction gameOver(){ playing=false; isPaused = false; pauseBtnEl.style.display = 'none'; gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'none'; msgEl.textContent='GAME OVER – Try Again!'; btnEl.style.display='inline-block';btnEl.textContent='Restart'; clearInterval(timerInt); }\nfunction startGame(){ \n    buildLevel(); \n    playing=true; isPaused=false; \n    msgEl.textContent=''; \n    btnEl.style.display='none'; \n    pauseBtnEl.style.display='inline-block'; pauseBtnEl.textContent='Pause';\n    gamePausedOverlayEl.style.display = 'none';\n    timeLeft=120; updateHUD(); \n    clearInterval(timerInt); \n    timerInt=setInterval(()=>{ \n        if(!playing || isPaused || !document.hasFocus() || questionModalEl.classList.contains('visible')) return; \n        timeLeft--;updateHUD(); \n        if(timeLeft<=0)gameOver(); \n    },1000); \n    if(document.hasFocus()) { requestAnimationFrame(loop); } \n}\n\n/* ---------- TOUCH CONTROLS (Revised for accuracy) ---------- */\nconst touchElement = cv;\n// ongoingTouches is an implicit global in this version\ntouchElement.addEventListener('touchstart', function(event) {\n    if ((!playing && !isPaused) || questionModalEl.classList.contains('visible')) return;\n    if(isPaused) return; \n    if(playing) event.preventDefault();\n\n    const canvasRect = cv.getBoundingClientRect();\n    for (let i = 0; i < event.changedTouches.length; i++) {\n        const touch = event.changedTouches[i];\n        const relativeX = touch.clientX - canvasRect.left;\n        ongoingTouches[touch.identifier] = { startX: touch.screenX, startY: touch.screenY, clientXStart: relativeX, timeStart: Date.now() }; \n        if (cv.clientWidth === 0) return;\n        if (relativeX < cv.clientWidth * TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO) { keys['ArrowLeft'] = true; keys['ArrowRight'] = false; leftTouchId = touch.identifier; }\n        else if (relativeX > cv.clientWidth * (1 - TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO)) { keys['ArrowRight'] = true; keys['ArrowLeft'] = false; rightTouchId = touch.identifier; }\n    }\n}, { passive: false });\ntouchElement.addEventListener('touchmove', function(event) {\n    if (!playing || isPaused || questionModalEl.classList.contains('visible')) return;\n    if(playing) event.preventDefault();\n    const canvasRect = cv.getBoundingClientRect();\n    if (cv.clientWidth === 0) return;\n    for (let i = 0; i < event.changedTouches.length; i++) {\n        const touch = event.changedTouches[i];\n        if (!ongoingTouches[touch.identifier]) continue;\n        const relativeX = touch.clientX - canvasRect.left;\n        if (touch.identifier === leftTouchId) { if (relativeX >= cv.clientWidth * TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO) { keys['ArrowLeft'] = false; leftTouchId = null; if (relativeX > cv.clientWidth * (1 - TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO)) { keys['ArrowRight'] = true; rightTouchId = touch.identifier; } } }\n        else if (touch.identifier === rightTouchId) { if (relativeX <= cv.clientWidth * (1 - TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO)) { keys['ArrowRight'] = false; rightTouchId = null; if (relativeX < cv.clientWidth * TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO) { keys['ArrowLeft'] = true; leftTouchId = touch.identifier; } } }\n        else { if (relativeX < cv.clientWidth * TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO) { keys['ArrowLeft'] = true; keys['ArrowRight'] = false; leftTouchId = touch.identifier; } else if (relativeX > cv.clientWidth * (1 - TAP_AREA_WIDTH_RATIO)) { keys['ArrowRight'] = true; keys['ArrowLeft'] = false; rightTouchId = touch.identifier; } else { if(leftTouchId === touch.identifier) { keys['ArrowLeft'] = false; leftTouchId = null; } if(rightTouchId === touch.identifier) { keys['ArrowRight'] = false; rightTouchId = null; } } }\n    }\n}, { passive: false });\ntouchElement.addEventListener('touchend', function(event) {\n    if (!playing || isPaused || questionModalEl.classList.contains('visible')) return;\n    for (let i = 0; i < event.changedTouches.length; i++) {\n        const touch = event.changedTouches[i];\n        const startData = ongoingTouches[touch.identifier];\n        if (startData) {\n            const deltaX = touch.screenX - startData.startX; const deltaY = touch.screenY - startData.startY;\n            const duration = Date.now() - startData.timeStart;\n            if (duration < SWIPE_TIME_THRESHOLD && deltaY < -SWIPE_THRESHOLD && Math.abs(deltaY) > Math.abs(deltaX) * 1.5) {\n                keys['Space'] = true; setTimeout(() => { keys['Space'] = false; }, 50);\n            }\n            if (touch.identifier === leftTouchId) { keys['ArrowLeft'] = false; leftTouchId = null; }\n            if (touch.identifier === rightTouchId) { keys['ArrowRight'] = false; rightTouchId = null; }\n            delete ongoingTouches[touch.identifier];\n        }\n    }\n    if (Object.keys(ongoingTouches).length === 0) { keys['ArrowLeft'] = false; keys['ArrowRight'] = false; leftTouchId = null; rightTouchId = null;}\n}, { passive: false });\n\nwindow.onfocus = () => { if (playing && !isPaused && timeLeft > 0 && lives > 0 && !questionModalEl.classList.contains('visible') ) { requestAnimationFrame(loop); }};\nfunction confetti(n=120, geoDashStyle = false){ const chosenAccent = getCSSVar('--accent'); const staticCols = [getCSSVar('--accent-neon-cyan'), getCSSVar('--accent-neon-magenta'), getCSSVar('--accent-neon-lime'), getCSSVar('--accent-neon-orange'), getCSSVar('--accent-neon-yellow')]; for(let i=0;i<n;i++){ setTimeout(()=>{ const d=document.createElement('div'); const particleColors = [chosenAccent, ...staticCols]; Object.assign(d.style,{ position:'fixed',left:'50%',top:'30%', width: geoDashStyle ? rand(4,10)+'px' : rand(6,12)+'px', height: geoDashStyle ? rand(4,10)+'px' : rand(6,12)+'px', background:particleColors[Math.floor(Math.random()*particleColors.length)], opacity:1, zIndex:9999, transform: geoDashStyle ? 'rotate(45deg)' : 'none', borderRadius: geoDashStyle ? '2px' : '50%' }); document.querySelector('.wrap').appendChild(d); let vx=(Math.random()-.5)*(geoDashStyle ? 8:6), vy=Math.random()*-9-3, grav=.3, life=0, maxLife=rand(70,110); (function anim(){ if(!document.body.contains(d)) return; life++;vx*=.98;vy+=grav; d.style.left=parseFloat(d.style.left)+vx+'px'; d.style.top=parseFloat(d.style.top)+vy+'px'; d.style.opacity=Math.max(0,1-life/maxLife); if(life<maxLife)requestAnimationFrame(anim);else d.remove(); })(); },i*(geoDashStyle? 5:10)); } }\n\ndocument.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => { \n    function applyAccentStyles() { \n        const currentAccent = getCSSVar('--accent');\n        const allButtons = document.querySelectorAll('button'); \n        allButtons.forEach(b => { \n            b.style.borderColor = currentAccent; \n            b.style.color = currentAccent;\n            b.style.boxShadow = `0 0 8px ${currentAccent}`;\n        });\n        const wrapEl = document.querySelector('.wrap'); \n        if(wrapEl){ wrapEl.style.borderColor = currentAccent; wrapEl.style.boxShadow = `0 0 30px ${currentAccent}`; } \n        const h2El = document.querySelector('h2');\n        if (h2El) { h2El.style.textShadow = `0 0 8px ${currentAccent}, 0 0 12px ${currentAccent}`; }\n        if (cv) { cv.style.borderColor = currentAccent; cv.style.boxShadow = `0 0 15px ${currentAccent}`; }\n    }\n    applyAccentStyles(); \n});\n\n</script>\n</body>\n</html>","source":"HTML"}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"dhr4k920","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}},"style":{},"id":"te4qb921","nodes":[],"type":"PARAGRAPH"},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"d80yz922","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"m5bfo923","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"6jhw0924","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}},{"type":"PARAGRAPH","id":"4smgu925","nodes":[],"paragraphData":{"textStyle":{"textAlignment":"AUTO"}}}],"documentStyle":{}}

Title: Sitting Down with the Editor‑in‑Chief of Science Magazine
Author: 49685452-57e8-4a40-846f-afc82ce23e5c
Excerpt: In an era of growing skepticism and polarized discourse, clear science communication is more vital than ever. We sat down with Holden Thorp to explore how one of the world’s leading science journals navigates this challenge. Join us as he reflects on his journey and the evolving role of scientific storytelling.
Plain Content: In an era of growing skepticism and polarized discourse, clear science communication is more vital than ever. We sat down with Holden Thorp to explore how one of the world’s leading science journals navigates this challenge. Join us as he reflects on his journey and the evolving role of scientific storytelling. Background In a time where trust in science is eroding and public discourse grows more polarized, accurately and effectively communicating new discoveries is becoming increasingly important for progress. Science communication is not only essential to spread information in a way that excites and informs people on the world around us, but to maintain a collaborative, interdisciplinary, and innovative scientific environment. Holden Thorp, the editor-in-chief of  Science Magazine , has taken on the role to mediate the efflux of such discovery, giving him a unique perspective on how science and related communication can be approached. Career trajectories can evolve unexpectedly—rather than following an idealized course, Dr. Thorp notes that he "didn't set out to be an editor in chief at Science ." His career has spanned academia and leadership: first, as a laboratory researcher and associate professor at North Carolina State University; later, as Chancellor of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill; and today, as both a professor at George Washington University and head of one of the highest impact science journals in the world. The Communication Conundrum A predisposition towards communication that is commonly held within the scientific community is that those who communicate science must also be experts in the laboratory. The traditional academic hierarchy often privileges research credentials over communicative abilities, an ideology that—as the United States continues to embrace anti-intellectualism—must be challenged. Thorp addresses this as a fatal flaw for science communicative efforts today: “Why does a great explainer need a pipette? If someone is good at explaining things to people, asking questions, understanding how science affects their lives—we need them to be doing all of those things, whether they’re also good in the laboratory or not.” Constructing restrictions to how scientific knowledge can circulate only succeeds in gatekeeping necessary paths that the public would otherwise take advantage of. Science communication, as a whole, exists not as a way to educate the general public on certain scientific topics—it is expressed as a way to excite  and get people engaged  in science; Thorp emphasizes that the path of treating science communication merely a vector for educational purposes has its faults: "Why should people learn science if they have a lot of other things to do? It would make for better citizens—but we’d have better citizens if people learned a lot of things, not just science." Bridging the Publication Gap To move forward, it's incredibly important to maintain the flow of information through engagement with platforms that expand science communication. Broader access to science is achieved through publishers such as Science, PNAS , Cell , and more. The role that these publishers play has never been to serve as mass communicators to the general public; instead, they were built to validate, archive, and advance scientific discovery, taking on immense responsibility to facilitate communication between researchers. "It’s important when you talk about science communication to understand what Science’s role is. We are not in the business of communicating science to the general public—we are a publication for scientists." As the demands for transparency, accessibility, and public engagement with science have grown, this traditional model has revealed its limitations, raising urgent questions about how the scientific enterprise can and should interact with the wider world. Thorp makes an important distinction: scientific journals exist primarily to facilitate communication between researchers, not to popularize findings for a lay audience. It's a necessary role, but not a complete solution to the communication gap.  DC's Role in the Future The solution to help solidify an integral role for science communicators in the coming years stems from Washington DC, the center of discourse for the attack on higher education—as well as the center for the world’s most prestigious institutes and facilities including the NIH, National Academy of Sciences, American Association for the Advancement of Science, and more. “DC has always been a center for science, it’s where most of the scientific societies are located, including mine. It’s where the NIH and many other national labs are, including several excellent research universities and hospitals—when you put all those things together, it’s one of the places that (is really great for science). It’s exciting.  The responsibility to bridge this gap doesn't fall only to journalists, doctors, or research specialists; it belongs to all those engaged with science. At institutions like Planet Forward , the D.C. Science Writers Association , and the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS) , students and professionals alike are already working to bring science out of the ivory tower and into everyday conversations. These organizations are shaping the future of scientific communication.  A Call to Action As Thorp continues to advocate for scientific engagement, we are reminded that all of us have a part to play as members of the scientific community. Whether you're a student passionate about climate change, a researcher with a story to tell, or simply curious about how science affects your world, now is the time to step in. Participate, write, speak, and amplify. Science needs your voice.

Title: How Coastal Trees Adapt Amid Rising Seas
Author: 5648f50e-d360-4ed6-8b44-1405f043d0d6
Excerpt: With rising seas and worsening droughts, coastal forests face an uncertain future. Scientist Riley Leff dives deep into the hidden strategies trees use to survive extreme stress, from strategic growth spurts to surprising water-handling tactics. Could understanding trees’ secret survival playbook help protect entire ecosystems, and even our planet?
Plain Content: With rising seas and worsening droughts, coastal forests face an uncertain future. Scientist Riley Leff dives deep into the hidden strategies trees use to survive extreme stress, from strategic growth spurts to surprising water-handling tactics. Could understanding trees’ secret survival playbook help protect entire ecosystems, and even our planet?
Text of Article: With rising seas and worsening droughts, coastal forests face an uncertain future. Scientist Riley Leff dives deep into the hidden strategies trees use to survive extreme stress, from strategic growth spurts to surprising water-handling tactics. Could understanding trees’ secret survival playbook help protect entire ecosystems, and even our planet?

Title: The Cosmic Journey of Dr. Duilia De Mello
Author: 208891e6-e28d-4e06-86b6-500b25d61f4e
Excerpt: From discovering supernovas to studying the birth of galaxies, Dr. Duilia De Mello's journey took her from Brazil to NASA in Washington, D.C. She uses the universe's oldest light to piece together our cosmic origins. But as the climate for science in America shifts, she questions whether the nation that drew her in will remain the best place on Earth to continue reaching for the stars.
Plain Content: From discovering supernovas to studying the birth of galaxies, Dr. Duilia De Mello's journey took her from Brazil to NASA in Washington, D.C. She uses the universe's oldest light to piece together our cosmic origins. But as the climate for science in America shifts, she questions whether the nation that drew her in will remain the best place on Earth to continue reaching for the stars. Introduction Dr. Duilia De Mello’s passion for astronomy inspired her to reach for the stars and even discover some of her own. But how did this accomplished Brazilian NASA researcher and physics professor make her way to DC? Dr. Duilia De Mello (Credit: Wikipedia) A Place to grow As a child, Dr. De Mello was curious about everything but could never find any answers, so she set out to discover them for herself. She sought to become an expert in the field of astronomy, which led her to pursue a Ph.D and participate in two post-doctorate programs at major telescopes located in Chile and Maryland. She even discovered a supernova in 1997 during her time at the European Southern Observatory in Chile. After completing her education, she became a professor at Chalmers University in Sweden.  A few years later, Dr. De Mello got an offer to work at NASA Goddard in Maryland. She needed a sponsor to do so, since only American citizens can work for government agencies, and Catholic University of America offered—where she has now worked for over 20 years. She is now a senior researcher at NASA and a tenured professor and vice provost at Catholic University. Dr. De Mello really likes working in DC because, “it's where all the action is.” She pointed out that when you look closely, there is a lot of research happening in and around DC, especially with all the universities and government research facilities. There are opportunities here, regardless of discipline, with organizations like NASA, the National Institute of Health (NIH), the National Institute of Standards and Technology, and much more. Dr. De Mello felt that  ending up in DC happened organically for her based on her connections and career aspirations. Quote: “working in DC was kind of a natural choice from the beginning” NASA Goddard Space Flight Center where Dr. De Mello works with her team to conduct research ( By NASA Goddard/Bill Hrybyk) Current research Dr. De Mello’s interests and education focused on galaxy formation and evolution, and she works on a multitude of projects in this area, some of which she spearheaded. Her work at NASA consists of deep space imaging using the Hubble SpaceTelescope. Her team analyzes the images and data from deep space and compares it to our own galaxy, the Milky Way, to help understand how our galaxy formed and what the formation process looked like.  Here’s how it works: it takes time for things to travel from one place to another, including light. But on Earth, light travels such small distances at such a fast speed that it appears instant to us. However, this is not the case for outer space. Even for something seemingly as close as our sun (which is about 93 million miles away), it still takes light 8 minutes to reach Earth. Now imagine looking at something a million times farther away—suddenly the light we see wasn’t produced just minutes ago, but years or even hundred of years earlier. So when you look at objects deep in the universe, you’re not just seeing incredibly far away, but also back in time! Dr. De Mello and her team use this to their advantage; when they look at data from a distant galaxy that is just starting to form, they can identify parts that are similar to the Milky Way, and use the information to piece together how it formed.  Dr. De Mello has also been studying blue blobs that result from colliding galaxies. Blue blobs are young stars that are born from the aftermath of a galactic collision. When galaxies “collide,” they don’t actually crash into each other—galaxies are filled with mostly empty space, so in reality they just slowly pass through each other. But the gravity from all the stars, planets, and other things in one galaxy can have a big impact on the other. This causes some gas to be pushed out of both galaxies, which is left in space. From the gas, stars are born.  Blue blobs captured by the Hubble Space Telescope. (Credit: NASA, ESA, and D. de Mello [Catholic University of America/GSFC]) Has America lost faith in science? Despite the success that Dr. De Mello has found in DC, she worries that her time here is coming to an end. Each year thousands of scientists immigrate to the US to seek unique opportunities—. according to the American Immigration Council, almost 25% of the STEM field is made up of foreign-born workers like Dr. De Mello. However, a recent shift in government leadership and public sentiment has drastically impacted the scientific community. Cuts in research funding, distrust in experts, limitations on what can be taught, and negative views on immigration are all starting to push talented scientists elsewhere. Dr. De Mello even says that she came to the United States because it had everything she was looking for. For the past few decades there has been a big push to find scientists of diverse backgrounds and remain one of the leading countries in technological advancements. But as the leadership and American public’s priorities change, it seems the focus is starting to shift. And if it stops being a place where Dr. De Mello has the support and funding to continue her work then she says it will be time for her to leave.  “You only do science if you have the proper condition to do good science.” What’s next? In the future, Dr. De Mello is planning to start a project with the James Webb Telescope. While the Hubble has been around for over 30 years, the James Webb Space Telescope was launched in 2021. Not only does it provide much clearer images than the Hubble, but it is an infrared telescope, which allows it to accurately capture light from the opposite side of the universe . Dr. De Mello is excited about this because it will allow us to see what the universe looked like 13 to 14 billion years ago, when it was young (relatively speaking). This would better help her to understand the history of the universe and analyze how it has grown and evolved. By understanding the origins of the universe, we can get closer to understanding how life and humans came to be—and Dr. De Mello hopes to be able to continue to do so in DC. Although Dr De Mello didn’t plan to come here, she has felt like it’s the place for her for the past 20 years and hopefully it will continue to be for a while.  Comparison of the southern ring nebula between the Hubble (left) and James Webb (right) Space Telescopes ( Credit Left: Hubble Heritage Team [STScI/AURA/NASA/ESA]) (Credit Right: NASA, ESA, CSA, STScI)
